Tour program Tour details Note Contact Other days
Day 1 : HO CHI MINH - NOI BAI (HANOI) - LAO CAI - SAPA (Lunch - Dinner)
You are present at the Tan Son Nhat Airport, Column 4, Domestic Terminal.
The tour guide shall make the procedures for you to catch a flight to Hanoi.
Vietravel's coach shall pick you up at Noi Bai airport, and then depart to Sa Pa on the modern and longest highway in Vietnam, connecting Hanoi and Lao Cai through Vinh Phuc, Phu Tho, Yen Bai.
Upon arrial in Sapa, check in and free at leisure.
In the afternoon, visit the Ta Van - Lao Chai Village. The road into Ta Van is winding with a side of Muong Hoa valley with fertile terraced fields adorned by the green of maize and rice.
Upon arrival at Ta Van Village, visit the houses of the Mong, Dao, Giay ethnic groups, and surely you will be surprised at the idyllic, rustic beauty .
In the evening, go for a walk and admire Sapa Stone church, then enjoy regional specialties such as: grilled pork, baked eggs, Tao Meo wine (a kind of traditional wine), communication with ethnic people.
Stay overnight in Sapa.
Day 2 : SA PA – MAJESTIC FANSIPAN - LAO CAI (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Visit the Silver Falls, O Quy Ho Pass - the boundary between the two provinces of Lao Cai and Lai Chau winding around Hoang Lien Range, also known as the Heaven Gate.
Here, you can admire the panoramic picture of extremely majestic and impressive northwestern mountains from above.
Take a coach to visit and conquer the majestic Fansipan mountain (expense excluded) - which was named as "Roof of Indochina" with a height of 3.143m.
Here, you will travel by cable cars which currently owns 2 Guinness, including the longest three-rope cable system in the world (6.325m) and the greatest elevation difference (1,410 m).
In addition, at the station of departure, you can visit and make Buddhist ceremony at Trinh Temple or bless fortune, peace for the family at the Ha Temple at the station of arrival.
Besides, during the journey to conquer Fansipan mountain, you have opportunity to look at the ecosystems, Sapa vast mountain scenery beneath, which is also a great and unforgettable experience.
Return to Lao Cai and check in.
Freedom to explore the city at night.
Stay overnight in Lao Cai.
Day 3 : SA PA - LAO CAI - HANOI (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Check out, and then depart to Bac Ha.
On arrival, you shall blend into the exciting atmosphere of the mountainous market - Bac Ha Market, known as the largest mountainous market in Lao Cai, where gathered many traders in neighboring ethic groups for exchange, trade but Bac Ha is more famous by its natural beauty.
Continue to visit Hoang A Tuong Palace - also known as the "H'Mong's King's Palace" built from 1914 owned by Hoang Yen Chao - Tay ethnic group, Hoang A Tuong's father.
After nearly 100 years of existence, the old house still stands majestically outstanding between a densely populated place, crowded streets.
Return to Hanoi, check in.
In the evening, you are free to explore the old town at night.
Stay overnight in Hanoi.
Day 4 : HANOI - YEN TU - HA LONG (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Continue to visit and understand about the life and work of the father of the nation at the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum (it is not open for visiting on weekly Mondays and Fridays), Uncle Ho's Stilt House, Ho Chi Minh Museum, One Pillar Pagoda.
Then, visit the Temple of Literature - where worships the Confucius and the Confucian sages - the first University of Vietnam.
Continue the journey to Halong, visit the Yen Tu Mountain (cable car costs excluded) - a natural attraction that was preserved with many historical sites and is known as "the land of Buddhism in Vietnam".
Then, visit the Hoa Yen Pagoda - a large and beautiful pagoda, situated on the halfway 516m in altitude, visit the Hue Quang Tower (Thap To).
Return to Ha Long in the afternoon, check in.
In the evening, take a coach to Bai Chay Bridge and then watch Ha Long City at night.
Return to the hotel, free at leisure or free to visit Tuan Chau Resort (expenses excluded), see circus performances of Dolphins, Seals .
Besides, you may visit Sun World Ha Long Park Ba Deo Mountain by Queen cable car from Bai Chay Beach, which reaches two world records (cabin with the world's largest capacity, 230 persons/cabin and the cable with the world's highest pole from land, T1 pole in 188.88m.), experience the solar wheel, visit the Japanese garden, wax exhibition area, children's recreation area, etc.
Overnight in Halong.
Day 5 : HA LONG - (NOI BAI) HANOI - HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast - Lunch)
Go to the wharf and take a cruise to go sightseeing in Ha Long Bay - a beautiful natural and extremely vivid scene, which was a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994.
Then, visit and explore the magnificence and luxury of the Heaven Palace Cave.
From the cruise, you can watch the islands in Halong Bay, including: Ga Choi Island, Lu Huong Island, etc.
Return to Hanoi, then take a coach to Noi Bai airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.

Upon arrial in Sapa, check in and free at leisure.
In the afternoon, visit the Ta Van - Lao Chai Village. The road into Ta Van is winding with a side of Muong Hoa valley with fertile terraced fields adorned by the green of maize and rice.
Upon arrival at Ta Van Village, visit the houses of the Mong, Dao, Giay ethnic groups, and surely you will be surprised at the idyllic, rustic beauty .
In the evening, go for a walk and admire Sapa Stone church, then enjoy regional specialties such as: grilled pork, baked eggs, Tao Meo wine (a kind of traditional wine), communication with ethnic people.

Day 2 : SA PA - LAO CAI (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Visit the Silver Falls, O Quy Ho Pass - the boundary between the two provinces of Lao Cai and Lai Chau winding around Hoang Lien Range, also known as the Heaven Gate.
Here, you can admire the panoramic picture of extremely majestic and impressive northwestern mountains from above.
Take a coach to visit and conquer the majestic Fansipan mountain (expense excluded) - which was named as "Roof of Indochina" with a height of 3.143m.
Here, you will travel by cable cars which currently owns 2 Guinness, including the longest three-rope cable system in the world (6.325m) and the greatest elevation difference (1,410 m).
In addition, at the station of departure, you can visit and make Buddhist ceremony at Trinh Temple or bless fortune, peace for the family at the Ha Temple at the station of arrival.
Besides, during the journey to conquer Fansipan mountain, you have opportunity to look at the ecosystems, Sapa vast mountain scenery beneath, which is also a great and unforgettable experience.
Return to Lao Cai and check in.
Freedom to explore the city at night.
Stay overnight in Lao Cai.

Option 1: Visit religious symbols of Nha Trang including Nui Cathedral (Nha Trang Cathedral) - located on top of Hoang Lan hill at an altitude of 12m at the city center.
The cathedral was built in the style of Western Catholic church, outstanding in the blue sky.
The trip continues with visit to Long Son pagoda which is an ancient pagoda with the largest scale among over 20 pagodas in Nha Trang.
The pagoda is located within the city of Nha Trang, at the foot of Trai Thuy Hill.
This is also one of the famous tourist attractions in Nha Trang.
Option 2: You can go for a walk in the seashore or participated in Vinpearl Land entertainment world (expenses excluded) with such games as: spinning acrobatics, carousel horse, gliding, racing, space exploration, or swimming in the sea, swimming in the largest pool in Southeast Asia, etc.
and enjoy modern music performances.
You will have to pay for transport back to the hotel or go for a walk at night.
In the evening, you can explore the beauty of Nha Trang culinary through popular dishes such as Ninh Hoa grilled meatball, Jellyfish noodles, Ponagar seafood street, etc.
Stay overnight in Nha Trang.
Day 3 : NHA TRANG - DA NANG - HUE (3 Meals)
After breakfast, you are free for visiting Nha Trang and check out.
The coach shall take you to the Nha Trang airport for a flight to Da Nang.
At the Da Nang Airport, Vietravel's coach shall take you and depart to Hue.
Upon arrival in Hue in afternoon, have dinner and free at leisure or export Hue City at night.
Stay overnight in Hue.
Day 4 : HUE - DAI NOI - THIEN MU PAGODA (3 Meals)
Vietravel's coach shall pick you up at the hotel, visit the Tomb of Tu Duc - with charming landscapes and to be one of the tombs with the most beautiful architecture of the Nguyen Kings.
Have lunch.
Check in and free at leisure.
In the afternoon, take a coach to visit the Hue Imperial City - the ancient palace of 13 Kings of the Nguyen Dynasty, visit Ngo Mon Gate, Thai Hoa Palace, Purple Forbidden City, The Temple, Hien Lam, Cuu Dinh, then, continue to visit the Thien Mu Pagoda- which is considered as the oldest pagoda in Hue and has preserved many valuable artifacts not only in term of history but also in art.
Enjoy dinner.
In the evening, you are free to sit down the Dragon Boat to travel on the Perfume River and enjoy Hue songs, drop flower garlands and bless for luck and peace (Expenses excluded).
Stay overnight in a 4 star hotel in Hue.
Day 5 : HUE - PHONG NHA CAVE - PARADISE CAVE (3 Meals)
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
You depart early to Dong Hoi (Quang Binh), stop along the way to visit the Truong Son Martyrs' Cemetery.
Upon arrival in Dong Hoi, have breakfast.
Then, continue to Phong Nha Cave - which is considered as the "fairyland" by being hidden in the limestone, covered by tropical forests, magnificent cave system with the longest underground river in the world, next visit: Bi Ky Cave, Toc Tien Cave, Palace Cave, etc.
Continue to visit the new cave in the World Heritage Site of Phong Nha - Ke Bang: Paradise Cave - Viewed as an underground palace, thanks to beautiful and dreamy limestone caves, with a record in the 30 km length which was discovered and put into operation in tourism in 2010.
Return to Dong Hoi, after dinner you are free to walk around Nhat Le Beach, eat seafood (expense excluded).
Stay overnight in Quang Binh
Day 6 : QUANG BINH - LA VANG HOLY LAND - LANG CO - DA NANG (3 Meals)
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
Check out.
Depart to Hue, on the way, stop to visit the Quang Tri ancient citadel, listen to explanation on Demilitarized Zone DMZ and Hien Luong Bridge - Ben Hai River (17th parallel), then continue the journey to the La Vang Holy Land.
Have lunch.
Continue the journey to Da Nang, stop to visit and take photos at Lang Co before going through Hai Van to Da Nang City, then check in and free at leisure.
Enjoy dinner.
In the evening, you shall take a car to experience the "Sun Wheel" at the Asian Park (expenses excluded) - belonging an architectural structure in combination between contemporary and ancient features, acculturation between Vietnam and other Asian countries designed by the skillful architect Bill Bensley.
Here, you can admire the Da Nang's sightseeing with a new perspective that has never been explored.
In particular, with the impressive height of 115m, the Sun Wheel is currently in top 10 highest wheels in the world.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.
Day 7 : DA NANG - BA NA - HOI AN Meals included: 3 meals
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
You take a car to visit the Ba Na - Suoi Mo, upon arrival, take the world's longest one-rope cable car to the Ba Na Mountain (cable car expenses excluded), enjoy the chilly air of the "Da Lat in the Central," then free to visit or travel by the hiking train (expenses excluded): Linh Ung Pagoda, Debay Cellars, Le Jardin D'Amour Garden, etc.
Next, you shall go to a new spiritual area of ​​Ba Na to visit the Linh Chua Linh Tu Temple - located atop Chua Mountain, where worships the goddess of the highlands (Bà Mẫu Thượng Ngàn), visit the Bell Tower, Linh Phong Tu Tower.
Continue to the Fantasy Park: `with new adventure games to enjoy thrilling experiences such as: Love Wheel, Skiver Pilot, Fire Racetracks, Ghost House and exhibition areas of over 40 wax - including wax of the famous singers, actors, scientists, leaders in the world...
Back to Da Nang for lunch.
In the afternoon, the coach will take you to visit Hoi An Old Town: Bridge Pagoda, Phung Hung Ancient House, Phuoc Kien Assembly Hall, Crafts establishments, then roam freely on the streets of colorful lanterns and buy souvenirs, test your skills in traditional games such as breaking earthen pot, Bai Choi singing.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.
Day 8 : DA NANG - SON TRA PENINSULA (Breakfast, Lunch, expense excluded dinner)
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
Take a coach to My Khe Beach - one of the most charming beach in the planet (Depending on weather situation: from December to March every year, instead of My Khe Beach because of cold sea, you shall arrive at Danang Galina Mud Bath &amp; Spa, including the cost of the pool bath, using the aquatic therapy system, costs of mud baths excluded).
Then visit the Ngu Hanh Son: Linh Ung Pagoda, Tang Chon Cave, Hoa Nghiem Cave, Non Nuoc Pagoda, Non Nuoc stone carving village.
Check out and eat lunch.
Continue to take a look around the Son Tra Peninsula, visit the Linh Ung Pagoda - which has a statue of the tallest Guan Yin Buddha statue in Vietnam (67m), equivalent to a 30-floor building.
Standing here, you will admire the panoramic view of the city, mountain and Son Tra island in a perfect way.
Overnight in Da Nang.
Day 9 : DA NANG - NOI BAI (HA NOI) - YEN TU - HA LONG (3 Meals)
Early in the morning, you shall take a coach to the Da Nang airport for a flight to Ha Noi.
At Noi Bai airport, Vietravel's coach shall pick you up for breakfast, then depart to Ha Long.
You visit the Yen Tu Mountain - a natural attraction that was preserved with many historical sites and is known as "the land of Buddhism in Vietnam". Then, take the cable to visit the Hoa Yen Pagoda (cable car costs excluded) - a large and beautiful pagoda, situated on the halfway 516m in altitude, visit the Hue Quang Tower (Thap To).
In the afternoon, check in, then visit the Tuan Chau Resort (expenses excluded), enjoy the crocodile performances or play games: ferris wheels, electric vehicles and ghost house, etc.
Besides you can visit Sun World Ha Long Park on Ba Deo mountain.
Overnight in Ha Long.
Day 10 : HA LONG - (NOI BAI) HANOI - HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast - Lunch)
Go to the wharf and take a cruise to go sightseeing in Ha Long Bay - a beautiful natural and extremely vivid scene, which was a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994.
From the cruise, you can watch the islands in Ha Long Bay, including: Ga Choi Island, Lu Huong Island, etc.
Then, continue to visit and discover the magnificence of Sung Sot Cave, which was voted in the top 10 most beautiful caves in the world, and is a double cave with thousands of magic stalactites discovered by the French in 1901.
Each compartment is a separate scene, which keeps audience stunned. One compartment is compared as a large theater with cave ceiling covered with stalactites; the other includes images associated with the legend of Saint Giong (Thanh Giong): the Horse, a long sword, etc.
The cruise will continue to take you to visit and conquer the Titop Island, from above you will discover the panorama view of majestic and lively Ha Long Bay.
Back to Hanoi, on the way, stop at Hai Duong to buy local specialties: green bean cake, sweet short cakes, etc.
Then go to Noi Bai airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.

Day 2 : Chengdu - Jiuzhaigou (Three meals)
You have breakfast at the hotel.
The coach takes you to Jiuzhaigou (about 9-10 hours).
You will have lunch at a local restaurant.
Along the way you have chances to admire the nature scenes on the two sides of Minjiang River.
On arrival of Jiuzhaizhou, you are taken to dinner at a local restaurant.
Check in and rest at the hotel.
Day 3 : Jiuzhaigou (Three meals)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
You then take public ecological cars going to visit Jiuzhaigou resort dubbed "Paradise on earth" located in the autonomous areas of Tibetan and Qiang ethinic groups, the majestic mountainous area at a altitude of 4,000m above the sea, with the natural landscape classified as second-to-none in China.
You will admire the rolling pine forests and hundreds of colorful and charming waterfalls and lakes - recognized by the UNESCO as the world's cultural heritage; this place is also the settings for making of Shuiguoshan scenes in the drama Journey to the West.
You also visit lakes formed from sedimentary limestone moutains, each of which bears a particular beauty, arranged by the nature into incredibly beautiful scenery: Hu lake, Huahuo lake, Wuhu lake, Zhang lake, Wuse sea - change the color according to the metabolism of the nature.
You have buffet lunch in the resort.
After the visit, the coach takes you to dinner and the hotel for a rest in Jiuzhaigou.
Day 4 : Jiuzhaigou - Mounigou or Huanglong - Mao Xian (Three meals)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
The coach will take you to shopping of technological items by Tibetan and Qiang ethnic groups.
After that, the coach takes you to visit Huanglong scenic area (The tour starts on 01 October and ends on 15 November- Where there is heavy snow in Huanglong, Mounigou is the alternative) After 15 November you will visit Mounigou (Mounigou valley) with the breathtaking views of the forests, mountaind and waterfalls).
Huanglong scenic area - the crayon stretching from the South to the North of Yushui mountain, is recognized by the UNESCO as "The world's natural heritage" in 1992 (cost for return cable car trip excluded).
After the visit to Huanglong or Mounigou, you are taken to Mao Xian.
You will stop to visit Red Army Monument, Chuanzhu temple, Songpan ancient town and Mao Xian Town.
You have dinner at a local restaurant.
Stay overnight in Mao Xian.
Day 5 : Mao Xian - Leshan - Emeishan (Three meals)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
The coach departs for Leshan.
On arrival in Leshan, you will take a boat trip for a visit of Leshan Dafo, a cultural heritage of the world, with a sitting Buddha, the world's biggest stone buddha carved on Qiluan top of Lingyun mountain under the Tang dynasty and yo can shop freely at crystal shops.
You have lunch at a local restaurant.
After that you are taken to Emeishan - the Buddhist land of China.
Have dinner at a local restaurant.
On arrival in Emei, you check in and get a rest.
Day 6 : Emeishan - Chengdu (Three meals)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
You will depart to visit Baoguo Temple - in front of and behind which has a Phoenix engraved.
At the entrance, the sign saying the three big words "Bao Guo Temple" was written by the Qing emperor Kangxi himself.
After that the coach takes you to the foot of Emeishan.
You visit Emeishan and take cable car to the highest top of Emeishan - Jinding, at your own cost.
From here, you can see the whole basin of Qingzang Plateau.
You also visit the four sided Buddha of 48m high, and Gold Temple, Silver Temple and Copper Temple.
Then you go down to the foot of the mountain at your own cost.
The coach picks you up at the foot of the mountain to come back to Chengdu.
Have dinner and check in, rest at the hotel.
Day 7 : Chengdu (Three meals)
You have breakfast at the hotel.

Vietravel's staff says goodbye.

Day 1 : HOCHIMINH CITY - SHENZHEN - BEIJING (Meals on the plane)
Vietravel's team leader will pick you up at the promised gate at Tan Son Nhat airport for flight to Beijing.
Transit in Shenzhen.
Arriving in Beijing at night of the next day, you are taken to the hotel for check-in and relax.
Day 2 : BEIJING (Three meals)
After the breakfast at the hotel you will visit the Forbidden City - the Chinese imperial palace from the Ming dynasty to the end of the Qing dynasty, covering an area of 720,000 m2 consisting of 800 buildings and 8,886 rooms, recognized by the UNESCO as the World Heritage; visit Tiananmen Square - the largest square of the world able to accommodate 1 million people at the same time. You also visit pearl store and Yihe Garden - previously the place to rest of the imperial family with unique architecture bearing China’s distinctive features with lakes, flower gardens, willows by the lakeside and also recognized by the UNESCO as a World Heritage.
The palace is not only a beautiful park but also an architecture masterpiece with utmost rigor and sophistication of feng shui.
Then, you go to shop feng shui statues at Dongbianmen – learning about feng shui statues, a spiritual animal bringing luck to Chinese people. You also enjoy unique circus performances.
Have dinner with the famous Beijing roast duck and come back to the hotel for a rest.
Day 3 : BEIJING (Three meals)
After the breakfast at the hotel you visit The Great Wall - one of the world’s wonders, the second-to-none human-made work for the military purposes.
You continue to visit the Ming tombs – a collection of mausoleums built by the 13 emperors of the Ming dynasty (1368-1644), recognized by the UNESCO as the World’s Cultural Heritage in 2003.
Then, you visit marble shops and the famous Tongrentang northern medicine store.
After the dinner you are free to shop on Wangfujing street.
Come back to the hotel to relax.
Day 4 : BEIJING - SHANGHAI (Three meals)
After the early check-out you depart for the airport for flight to Shanghai.
On arrival, you will visit Yufo Temple, knife stores, visit Shanghai Bund.
Then you are free to shop on Nanjing street.
Check in and get rest at the 3 star hotel.
Day 5 : SHANGHAI - SUZHOU (Three meals)
After the breakfast, you depart for Suzhou in an air conditioned coach.
You will pay a visit to Hanshan Temple - one of the Chinese ancient temples with the famous fresco named “Hanshan - Shide” carved on stone by a Qing painter.
You continue to visit Lion Grove Garden - An architectural masterpiece of forest park in Suzhou, one of the four most beautiful forest gardens in Suzhou.
Inside the Lion Grove Garden, a lot of magic man-made caves were built which are like mazes.
Then, you visit a famous silk factory in Suzhou and zisha teapot stores.
Have dinner and check in a 3 star hotel.
Day 6 : SUZHOU - WUXI - HANGZHOU (Three meals)
After breakfast, you get on the coach to go to Wuxi, visiting China's Three Kingdoms studio - where replays images of China of the Three Kingdoms period with houses, palaces, temples, and warships…, here, you also have chances to sightsee the charming Taihu Lake .
This is also the context for making of the 2014 famous drama Wuzetian.
You continue to depart for Hangzhou.
On arrival in Hangzhou, you take a boat trip on West lake - Hangzhou's most famous place of interest.
After the lunch you continue to visit Yuefei Temple - where the national hero in Nansung period is worshiped.
Then you visit Longjing tea garden and have a chance to enjoy the famous imperial tea.
Have dinner and get rest at a 3 star hotel.
Day 7 : HANGZHOU - GUANGZHOU - HOCHIMINH CITY (Breakfast)
Having breakfast at the hotel, you are free until going to the airport for flight to Guangzhou; light lunch is on the plane.
On arrival at Guangzhou, you catch the flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Arrive in the Tan Son Nhat Airport, the tour ends.
Vietravel's staff says goodbye.

Day 1 : HO CHI MINH CITY - KUALA LUMPUR: (Snacks at airport and dinner)
Vietravel's Head of the tour will receive you at the appointed gate of Tan Son Nhat airport to make procedure to take a flight to Kuala Lumpur (the flight will transit in Singapore and you will have snacks at the airport).
After arriving in Kuala Lumpur, you will visit jewelry store, National Monument, Thean Hou Temple, Independence Square with the world's highest flagpole; visit and take photos outside Royal Palace and Parliament House.
Afterward, the coach will take you to freely go shopping at Chocolate store, specialty store, watch store and take photos at Petronas Twin Towers.
After having dinner, you will check in and get rest at 3 star hotel.
Day 2 : KUALA LUMPUR - GENTING: (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
Visit Batu Cave - According to Malaysian people, Batu Cave is the place of gods, so Batu becomes the place for worshiping and the center of festivals.
This is also the most sacred place of Hindu devotees in Malaysia.
43m-high Murugan statue is covered by glittering golden paint and stands in front of the entrance. You can freely go shopping at duty free shops and local specialty stores.
Afterward, the coach will take the tour to Genting Highlands by cable hanger. This is a city in the cloud, with the altitude of about 2000 meters above the sea level and you can try your luck at the most famous casino in the Southeast Asia.
Return to Kuala Lumpur, get rest and enjoy dinner at a local restaurant.
Day 3 : KUALA LUMPUR - MALACCA: (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
The tour starts a journey to Malacca, visits gem store and freely buys local specialties.
After lunch, the coach will take the tour to visit new Putrajaya city: Islamic Mosque, Putrajaya Bridge.
The tour continues to visit the ancient city of Malacca.
Once arriving, you will visit Cheng Hoon Temple, Church of St. Paul, Porta de Santiago Ancient Fortress (one of the four main gates of A Famosa Fortress), Stadhuys - where used to be the administration center of Dutch people and now is a historical museum.
After having dinner, the tour will check in and get rest at a three-star hotel.
Day 4 : MALAYSIA - SINGAPORE (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
The tour departs to Singapore.
On arrival, the local coach and tour guide take you to have lunch.
Continuing the journey, you will visit Botanic Garden, Orchid Garden - a collection of Singaporean Orchid Garden with more than 1000 natural orchid species and 3000 cross-bred orchid species.
Moreover, many cross-bred species with various colors and durability will be supplemented into the impressive collection, etc.
You will visit a special ecological garden named Bay South Garden, with a "super tree" system of solar energy.
The garden belongs to the Gardens by the Bay project which is the biggest ecological project in Singapore to improve the quality of life and retain the green for the bustling city.
The area of the whole project is 101 ha and is divided into three separate areas, including: Bay South, Bay East and Bay Central (only visit Bay South - ticket for visiting two botanic gardens excluded).
After the dinner, the coach and tour guide will take the tour to check in and get rest at a three-star hotel.
Day 5 : SINGAPORE: (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
You will visit Jurong Bird Park - The biggest and the most impressive bird park in the Asia Pacific with over 9,000 feather friends of more than 600 species.
The world of birds here is very diverse with many types: yellow cranes, quails, pheasants, storks, heron, pelicans, parrots, starlings, blackbirds swans, etc.
They live on trees, on the ground, in the barns, on the cliffs in the middle of the lake, or swim in swarms relaxedly and freely.
Some species have only one typical colors such as flamingo having pink colors, yellow cranes having yellow colors, swans having pure white colors, blackbirds having green colors and parrots having pure black color.
May other species are the mixture of many harmonious and lively colors such as peacock, quails, parrots, and orioles.
The tour continues to visit diamond factory and green oil shop.
The tour has lunch with Korean BQQ dishes.
In the afternoon, you will visit Sentosa Island - one of the most famous entertainment area in the region.
When arriving at Sentosa, you will visit Sky Tower - with the height of 110m and you can take an overview of the whole Singapore, southern islands and Sentosa.
Then, you will visit S.E.A Aquarium, or "the world's biggest aquarium" - with 45 million liters of water, a giant artificial ocean simulating 49 different habitats and an extremely impressive design. Tourists will be certainly surprised by over 100,000 sea creatures of 800 species and 20,000 types of colorful coral.
After dinner, You will enjoy the program“Wings of Time” – which is a completely new and interesting program in Singapore with the combination between fire effects, high pressure water spraying robots, colorful LED system and modern Laze system, creating lively and original 3D effects.
The program is performed on Siloso beach along with a firework performances which promise to leave the tourists with unforgettable impression.
Return to the hotel to get rest.
Day 6 : SINGAPORE – HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
Afterward, you will visit Parliament House of Singapore, Merlion Park, Victoria Theater, Suntec city.
Then, the coach shall take you to the airport to catch the flight to Vietnam.
Arrive in the Tan Son Nhat Airport, the tour ends.
Afterward, the Head of Vietravel's tour will say goodbye and see you again in the next programs.

Then, you will visit Buddha Tooth Relic Temple which is a big pagoda and plays an important role in the spirit and religion of the local people.
You will visit a special ecological garden named Bay South Garden with a "super tree" system of solar energy.
The garden belongs to the Gardens by the Bay project which is the biggest ecological project in Singapore to improve the quality of life and retain the green for the bustling city.
The area of the whole project is 101 ha and is divided into three separate areas, including: Bay South, Bay East and Bay Central (only visit Bay South area and the ticket for visiting gardens in the green house is excluded).
You can also experience the thrilling and interesting feelings when stepping onto OCBC Skyway - a 128m long suspended line connecting the two super trees which are very suitable for walking at any point of time and where you can gaze at the whole garden and the scenery of the gulf city in Marina Bay Area from the height (expense excluded).
Have dinner.
The tour checks in and gets rest at 3 star hotel.
Day 2 : SINGAPORE: (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
You will visit Jurong Bird Park - The biggest and the most impressive bird park in the Asia Pacific with over 9,000 feather friends of more than 600 species.
Freely go shopping at Diamond Industry, Habour Mart.
Enjoy Korean BBQ dishes.
In the afternoon, the tour will depart to Sentosa Island.
You will visit Maritime Museum, Typhoon Cinema and S.E.A Aquarium - which are proud to be the biggest aquarium in the world.
S.E.A has a collection of many species of rare and valuable fish from the ocean across the world.
In the evening, you can enjoy the program “Wings of Time” – which is a completely new and interesting program in Singapore with the combination between fire effects, high pressure water spraying robots, colorful LED system and modern Laze system, creating lively and original 3D effects.
The program is performed on Siloso beach along with a firework performances which promise to leave the tourists with unforgettable impression.
Have dinner, get rest at the hotel.
Day 3 : SINGAPORE: (Breakfast)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
You freely discover Merlion Island Country.
(Expense for tour guide, coach, lunch, dinner and entrance tickets at tourist sites are excluded).
With the suggestion on visiting and understanding typical features of Merlion Island Country as follows:
- China Town: is characterized by dishes or temples imbued with Chinese characteristics.
-Kampong Glam Street of Malaysian people or Little India of Indian people with typical smells of Indian foods.
You can freely visit and go shopping at Orchard city or Bugis city - with famous shopping centers in Singapore shopping paradise.
- Play at Universal: the entertainment park simulates a big filming location in Hollywood.
With an average of about 20 ha, the entertainment area includes modern amusement area, scenes and shapes of popular characters in movies, such as: Jurassic Park, Shrek, Madagascar, mysterious Egypt, etc.
- Duck Tour: With 60 minutes of traveling around the city in a special vehicle which can travel on both land and water, You can view Singapore from two different directions from the land and the water, which is very interesting.
- View Singapore from ferries wheel Singapore Flyer: Its height is equivalent to the height of a 42-floor building.
Standing at the dizzy height of 165m, you will feel the beautiful landscape of Singapore sky: Majestic Marina Bay, skyscrapers, the green of tropical forest and flashing lights on the magic sky.
- Freely discover and enjoy various foods in Singapore such as Singaporean chili crab and frog porridge which are famous in the world.
- Clarke Quay: is a destination for dining and entertainment activities in Singapore. It is a lively picture with colorful buildings.
Here, you can see many antique shops, restaurants, stylish cafes, jazz clubs and more.
When the night falls, the whole area is outstanding with five bright buildings and an array of famous clubs for tourists to freely select.
With multiple choices for international-class gathering and entertaining activity, this is really an ideal place for people across the world.
After the journey to freely discover the beautiful Singapore, you will return to the hotel to get rest.
Day 4 : SINGAPORE - HO CHI MINH CITY: (Breakfast)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
You freely visit until the time when the coach takes you to Changi International airport to take a flight to return to Vietnam.
Return to Tan Son Nhat Airport and end the tour.
After arriving at Tan Son Nhat airport, the Head of Vietravel's tour will say goodbye and see you again in the next programs.

We've known Korean as a dynamic and modern country through movies of this country.
In the transitional moments of the seasons, "the country of kimchee" is splendid as if it puts on a brilliant shirt captivating man's heart throughout four seasons of spring, summer, autumn and winter.
Let's explore Korea together with Vietravel. Discover Seoul which is magnificient by temples in harmony with sparkling color of trees at defoliation season, Nami or Morning Calm park with romatic and lyric landscape.
Accompanied service
Insurance
Meals
Guides

Tour program Tour details Note Contact Other days
Day 1 : HO CHI MINH CITY – SEOUL - JEJU (Lunch - Dinner)
On night before day 1, Vietravel's coach and tour guide pick up you at Tan Son Nhat Airport and then catch a flight to Seoul - the capital of Korea.
You stay overnight on the plane.
Upon arrival in Korea, visit the Gyeongbok Royal Palace - the primary residence of the Royal Family during the Chosun Dynasty (1392-1910).
This palace has 7225 rooms with magnificent throne, and elegant halls.
Gyeongbok Palace is considered as a famous works of art with the unique and most beautiful architectural style of Seoul.
Visit the National Museum of Traditional Culture - which is the leading museum showcasing folklore of Korea, attracting 3 million visitors annually.
The museum contains more than 98,000 artifacts representing the full details of the main events and festivals of the country, especially the intangible cultural value as well as the daily life activities of Korean people.
Visit the “Blue House” (also known as Cheongwadae) - which is a residence and working place of Korean President.
Have lunch and connect the flight to Jeju Island.
To the Jeju Island - a beautiful island with a peaceful landscape, sunny and windy coast.
The coach and local guide shall welcome and take you to visit Yongduam - a famous beach with Dragon Head Rock as a symbol of Jeju Island, known as the Dragon Head Rock because of being seen from a distance, the rock looks like the head of a dragon flying on blue sky.
Then you will have interesting experiences at Spooky Path - where the cars, despite the shutdown, can still be climbing uphill without any explanation for; visit the Park of Love.
Have dinner and check in, rest at the hotel.
Day 2 : JEJU (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast, visit the Seongsan Ilchulbong Peak - where welcomes firstly the sunshine in Korea.
From the blue water of the sea, with undulating rosy dawn in the sun, that moment is hard to describe in words.
You visit the Seongeup ethnic village recreating the scenes of lives of ancient people on the island.
Then, you have lunch with grilled meat dishes that are characteristic of Jeju Island in the village.
In the afternoon, the tour continues to Cheonjiyeon Waterfall - the name which means "the place where heaven and earth meet"; according to legend, this is a place where fairies roam.
You will continue to visit the Jusan-jelli Cliffs - formed thousands of years ago from volcanic eruptions and from the hands of nature, the cliffs consist of the overlapping hexagonal shape of the blocks that are extremely unique.
Then, you visit the Yakcheonsa Temple - one of the stately modern temples of Asian Buddhism, beautiful art architecture, which has attracted tourists both at home and at broad.
In the central chamber has 18,000 Buddha gold-plated statues, 500 Arhat wooden statues, a 18 ton bell.
The temple is surrounded by mountains and forests, fragrant grass and fruit trees such as Orange, Tangerine.
After that, enjoy dinner and return to the hotel for rest.
Day 3 : JEJU - SEOUL - LOTTE WORLD PARK - LOTTE AQUARIUM (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast, you get on the bus to the airport for the flight back to Seoul.
To Seoul, you shall go sightseeing and shopping in ginseng stores, Korean cosmetic stores.
You are free to visit and play in Lotte World Park - divided into two large areas, indoors and outdoors; this is the park with the world's largest indoor game area.
Not only the largest one, it is also very attractive with many activities and games that are not available everywhere and attract millions of tourists every year.
Lotte World is one of the entertainment complex that attract a lot of tourists in the world.
Especially, during this summer, you have the opportunity to visit the newly opened Lotte Aquarium - the largest and most modern aquarium in Seoul with more than 55,000 sea creatures from 650 species from the ocean such as white precious, clever and glib Beluga whale which is the star of the Lotte Aquarium.
Visit the Dongdaemun market - known for fashion stores.
Have dinner and make check-in procedures at the Seoul hotel.
You get rest and relax at the hotel or explore Seoul on the night.
Day 4 : SEOUL - NAMI - ART PERORMANCE SHOWS (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast at the hotel, get on the coach to visit the Nami Island - located 63 km from the Seoul capital.The island is beautiful and peaceful by the flora with over 200 different types of trees.
The most famous thing are branches of maple leaves along with straight rows of Ginkgo trees that had appeared in the drama "Winter Sonata".
Then you are free to visit and shop at Korea Garden and the red pine oil store.
In the afternoon, enjoy the unique art performances including Nanta show or Drum Cat show.
Enjoy dinner and get rest at the hotel or go for a walk around Seoul.
Day 5 : SEOUL – HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast)
You have breakfast at the hotel.
The coach shall take you to the airport for a flight back to Vietnam.
Upon arrival at the Tan Son Nhat Airport, the tour ends.
Vietravel's staff says goodbye.See all

Tourists will have opportunities to visit Barcelona bustling with Samba ... The journey also takes tourists to experience purple lavender flower season with fragrant and unforgettable scent.

Tour program Tour details Note Contact Other days
Day 1 : HO CHI MINH – NICE
The coach shall pick you up at the meeting point in the city.
Go to airport to catch a flight to the city of Nice located south of France.
Overnight on board.
The transit flight is in Dubai.
Day 2 : NICE – GRASSE – NICE (Dinner)
Upon arrival in Dubai, you shall catch a flight to Nice - located at the southern coast of France, in the province of Provence - Alpes - Code d'Azur.
Here, you visit the Frangonard Perfumery perfume factory - a famous brand with premium fragrances and aromas.
You will be visiting a museum with the theme of the 3000 year history of perfume industry, watch the bottles used to keep things gold-like expensive solutions, in which has a number of bottles from the ancient Egypt and China time.
Then, you will enjoy the famous panoramic stretches of sandy beach of France and luxurious cruises mooring in the harbor along the walking street “Promenade des Anglais”.
After dinner at a local restaurant, check in and get rest at the hotel.
Day 3 : NICE - MONACO – NICE (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast at the hotel, the tour guide shall take you to the beautiful Monaco, taking photos outside the Cathedral and the Rose Garden of Princess Grace.
You have meal at a local restaurant.
In the afternoon, visit the City of Cannes linking to the world famous Cannes Film Festival.
In the evening, come back to Nice for dinner.
Rest at the hotel.
Day 4 : NICE - GORDES – AVIGNON (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast and check out
Then, depart to the City of Avignon - City of the Popes.
Here, visit the roads, the ancient Gothic architectures, the Palais des Papes Palace - a UNESCO world heritage site.
Have dinner at a local restaurant and get a hotel room to rest.
Day 5 : AVIGNON – BARCELONA (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast and check out.
You visit the famous Pont du Gard - the bridge was built of stone across the Gardon river including 3 floors with a length of 275m and a maximum height of 49m.
This is the highest aqueduct among similar works in Roman times.
After lunch at a local restaurant, you continue the journey to the city of Barcelona - the famous port city of Spain.
On arrival, have dinner and check in hotel and rest.
Day 6 : BARCELONA (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast, the coach and tour guide take you begin the journey to explore the city of Barcelona: visit the Spanish Village - an outdoor museum located on the Monjuit Hill with Spanish architecture houses which are built to simulate a very unique small village; visit the Camp Nou Museum and Stadium of Barcelona football club.
Continue to visit the Sagrada Familia Cathedral - World Cultural Heritage designed by the genius architect Gaudi with very unique and new styles.
Enjoy dinner at a local restaurant and stay overnight at the hotel.
Day 7 : BARCELONA – MADRID (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Eat breakfast and check out.
Then, take a ferry to the city of Madrid - Spain's capital city.
On arrival, the coach and tour guide take you to have lunch.
After lunch, you visit the city of Madrid: Royal Palace - the largest and most impressive palace in Europe; Spain Square - the central square of the city with the monument of Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra writer, the author of Don Quixote masterpiece, Retiro Park - a witness of the history of the reign of the Spanish monarchy, the most famous park and one of the symbols of Madrid capital.
Enjoy dinner at a local restaurant and rest in the hotel in Madrid.
Day 8 : MADRID – LISBON (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast and check out.
Continue to visit the city of Madrid: Prado Museum, Gate of the Sun.
After lunch, go to the airport to catch the flight to Lisbon - the Capital of Portugal.
To Lisbon, you shall enjoy dinner at a local restaurant and then free at leisure.
Day 9 : LISBON – CABO DA ROCA – LISBON (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
Then, depart to visit the SE Cathedral - the most important religious architecture in the Portugal and visit the Pena Palace - built on a hilltop in Sintra in the middle of vast green, be one of the main symbols of romanticism of the nineteenth century in Portugal, watch the Cabo Da Roca Lighthouse located on the westernmost strip of Portugal; After lunch, continue to visit the Belem Tower, Jeronimos Monastery, Royal Coach Museum - museum of antique cars.
Back to Lisbon, dine at a restaurant and relax at the hotel.
Day 10 : LISBON - FATIMA – LISBON (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast at the hotel.
After check out, go along the Cascais Bay to Fátima City - the religious capital of Portugal.
Here, you will visit the Valihnos Monument, Sanctuary of Our Lady, visit the Francisco and Jacinta's House, the Chapel where the Virgin appeared.
After dinner, check in and get rest at the hotel.
Day 11 : LISBON - HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast)
Have breakfast and check out, you are free to the gathering time to go to the airport for a flight to Vietnam.
The transit flight is in Dubai.
Day 12 : HO CHI MINH CITY
Arrive at Tan Son Nhat airport, Vietravel's coach shall pick up and take you to the meeting point in the city.
End the tour.

On arrival in Paris - the fashion capital of the world.
The coach and local guide shall take you for lunch at a local restaurant.
In the afternoon, visit the Eiffel Tower - up to 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower to view the city; Notre Dame - famous for the classic work "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" by Victor Hugo; take a cruise on poetic Seine River; visit the Concorde Square. Arc de Triomphe, the Champs Élysées Boulevard.
Check in.
Have dinner.
Visit the Paris at night.
Day 3 : PARIS (Three meals)
Eat breakfast at the hotel.
You take the coach to the suburbs of Paris, visiting the ancient Castle of Versailles which is a UNESCO world cultural heritage.
You have lunch at a local restaurant.
In the afternoon, visit the Louvre Museum - where displays masterpieces of world famous painters.
In the evening, you are free at leisure.
Day 4 : PARIS- VENICE- FLORENCE (Three meals)
Have breakfast and check out.
Then, go to the airport for a flight to Venice - a floating city.
Then, visit the Square and the Church of St.Marco, Murano Glass Factory, take photos at the Doge's Palace, go canoe - a characteristic mean of transportation in Venice Island (costs shall be paid by tourists, about 100Eu for 1 boat/4 people).
In the afternoon, you move to the city of Florence, get a hotel room to rest.
Day 5 : FLORENCE- PISA- ROME (Three meals)

In the afternoon, depart to the city of Rome - the capital of the Kingdom of Italy.
Have dinner and check in.
Day 6 : ROME (Three meals)
Eat breakfast at the hotel.
In the morning, visit: Vatican Museum - one of the largest museums in the world.
The great architectural building is an valuable treasure of Rome and Vatican; Sistine Chapel - that is also the meeting place of the Cardinals for election of a new Pope, and is the venue for the summit meetings between the Pope and the heads of state.
But above all, this is a place to keep the two paintings, "Morning Century" and "The Last Judgment" by Michelangelo painted on the ceiling and on the wall; St.Peter's Basilica - the most sacred place in the Vatican, attracting many believers and visitors from around the world.
Located on the burial place of St.Peter, this world greatest and most magnificent basilica has a dome of 136 meters high designed by Michelangelo, containing hundreds of priceless works of art; visit outside the Castel Sant'Angelo.
After dinner, go to the hotel for rest.
Day 7 : ROME – HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast, Lunch)

To Paris - the capital of France,t coach and local tour guide shall welcome and take you visit the city

Day 3 : PARIS (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
You have breakfast at the hotel.
You visit the Paris on a full day. The Louvre Museum, the Arc de Triomphe, the Champs Élysées Boulevard.
You have dinner, get rest at the hotel.
Day 4 : PARIS - STRASBOURG - TITISEE- ZURICH (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast, depart to the city of Strasbourg - the city of Christmas festivities located at the border of France - Germany by ship.
To Strasbourg, you take a coach to Titisee - located in southwest of Germany in the heart of Black Forest, a famous place for Cuckoo clock stores.
In the afternoon, before the visit to the city of Zurich, you go to Schaffhausen - a city located in Switzerland, bordering with Germany to admire the majestic beauty of the Rhine Falls waterfall - the largest waterfall in Europe, then continue to the city of Zurich, take photos outside the Frauenkirche Church and the Old Town.
Then, have dinner, get rest at the hotel.
Day 5 : ZURICH – TITLIS- LUCERN (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
Enjoy breakfast at the hotel.
In the morning, visit the Titlis Mountain by cable to admire the majestic beauty covered by the snow of the Alps.
In the afternoon, back to Lucerne for a city tour: The Lion Monument - a memorial sculpture of more than 800 Swiss soldiers who sacrificed themselves to protect King Louis XVI of France during the Revolution in 1789.
Visit the Chapel Bridge, from here you can see the Jesuit Church.
You are free for shopping and free at leisure.
Day 6 : LUCERN – MILAN- VENICE (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast, make the procedures of check out.
On the way to Venice, take a stop in Milan City - the fashion capital of the world.
Visit and take photos outside the Sforza Castle, Duomo Church, La Scala Opera House, Galleria Vittorio Emanuele.
Then, continue to go to Venice and check in the hotel there.
Day 7 : VENICE - PISA (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast at the hotel, begin the journey by visiting the Venice Island to admire the city floating on the sea: Square and the Church of St.Marco, Murano Glass Factory, take photos at the Doge's Palace, go canoe - a characteristic mean of transportation in Venice Island (costs shall be be paid by tourists, about 100Eu for 1 boat/4 people ).
In the afternoon, move to the city of Pisa, check in and get rest.
Day 8 : PISA - ROME (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast and check out.
On the way, stop to visit the Leaning Tower of Pisa - a UNESCO world heritage site.
In the afternoon, go to the Rome and check in there.
Day 9 : ROME (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
You have breakfast at the hotel.
In the morning, visit the Vatican Museum - one of the largest museums in the world.
This great architectural work is a valuable asset of Rome and the Vatican.
It exhibits many precious works of art from the large collections created by Roman Catholic church over the centuries.
In the museum, the most famous structure is the Sistine Chapel - that is also the meeting place of the Cardinals for election of a new Pope, and is the venue for the summit meetings between the Pope and the heads of state.
But above all, this is a place to keep the two paintings, "Morning Century" and "The Last Judgment" by Michelangelo painted on the ceiling and on the wall.
You visit St.Peter's Basilica - the most sacred place in the Vatican, attracting many believers and visitors from around the world.
Located on the burial place of St.Peter, the world greatest and most magnificent cathedral has a dome of 136 meters high designed by Michelangelo, containing hundreds of priceless works of art.
Have dinner and check in.
Day 10 : ROME (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
Have breakfast.
Then, visit and take photos outside the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain.ét/Free for shopping in the city.
Have dinner and return to hotel to rest.

After breakfast, go to the airport to catch a flight to Vietnam (Transit flight is specified by airlines).
Day 12 : HO CHI MINH CITY
At the Tan Son Nhat Airport, the coach shall take you to the Vietravel's Office (190 Pasteur, District 3, HCMC), the tour ends.

Day 1 : HO CHI MINH CITY - HUE Meals included: 2 meals (lunch, dinner)
You are present at the Tan Son Nhat Airport, Column 4, Domestic Terminal.
Vietravel's tour guide shall support you in procedures to catch a flight to Hue.
At the Phu Bai Airport - Hue, Vietravel's coach and tour guide shall pick you up to visit the Tomb of Tu Duc - with charming landscapes and to be one of the tombs with the most beautiful architecture of the Nguyen Kings.
Have lunch.
Check in and free at leisure.
In the afternoon, take a coach to visit the Hue Imperial City - the ancient palace of 13 Kings of the Nguyen Dynasty, visit Ngo Mon Gate, Thai Hoa Palace, Purple Forbidden City, The Temple, Hien Lam, Cuu Dinh, then, continue to visit the Thien Mu Pagoda- which is considered as the oldest pagoda in Hue and has preserved many valuable artifacts not only in term of history but also in art.
Have dinner.
In the evening, you are free to sit down the Dragon Boat to travel on the Perfume River and enjoy Hue songs, drop flower garlands and bless for luck and peace (Expenses excluded).
Stay overnight in Hue.
Day 2 : HUE - PHONG NHA CAVE - PARADISE CAVE Meals included: 3 meals
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
You depart early to Dong Hoi (Quang Binh), stop along the way to visit the Truong Son Martyrs' Cemetery.
Upon arrival in Dong Hoi, have lunch.
Then, continue to Phong Nha Cave - which is considered as the "fairyland" by being hidden in the limestone, covered by tropical forests, magnificent cave system with the longest underground river in the world, next visit: Bi Ky Cave, Toc Tien Cave, Palace Cave, etc.
Continue to visit the new cave in the World Heritage Site of Phong Nha - Ke Bang: Paradise Cave - Viewed as an underground palace, thanks to beautiful and dreamy limestone caves, with a record length of more than 30 km.
Return to Dong Hoi, after dinner you are free to walk around Nhat Le Beach, eat seafood (expense excluded).
Stay overnight in Quang Binh.
Day 3 : QUANG BINH - LA VANG - LANG CO - DA NANG Meals included: 3 meals
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
Check out.
Depart to Hue, on the way, stop to visit the Quang Tri ancient citadel, listen to explanation on Demilitarized Zone DMZ and Hien Luong Bridge - Ben Hai River (17th parallel), then continue the journey to the La Vang Holy Land.
Have lunch in Hue.
Continue the journey to Da Nang, stop to visit and take photos at Lang Co - one of the most beautiful bays in the world before going through Hai Van Tunnel to Da Nang City, then check in and free at leisure.
Have dinner.
In the evening, freely visit the Asian Park (expenses excluded): a leading amusement park in Southeast Asia of world-class standard, you are free to experience "the Sun Wheel" - an impressive height of 115m, currently under the top 10 world's highest wheels, admire sightseeing of Da Nang from many different heights, a architectural structure in combination with contemporary features and cross-culture between Vietnam and other Asian countries, designed by the skilful architect Bill Bensley - one of five leading designers in the world in the tourism industry.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.
Day 4 : DA NANG - BA NA - HOI AN Meals included: 3 meals
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
You take a car to visit the Ba Na - Suoi Mo, upon arrival, take the world's longest one-rope cable car to the Ba Na Mountain (cable car expenses excluded), enjoy the chilly air of the "Da Lat in the Central," then free to visit or travel by the hiking train (expenses excluded): Linh Ung Pagoda, Debay Cellars, Le Jardin D'Amour Garden, etc.
Next, you shall go to a new spiritual area of ​​Ba Na to visit the Linh Chua Linh Tu Temple - located atop Chua Mountain, where worships the goddess of the highlands (Bà Mẫu Thượng Ngàn), visit the Bell Tower, Linh Phong Tu Tower.
Continue to the Fantasy Park: with new adventure games to enjoy thrilling experiences such as: Love Wheel, Skiver Pilot, Fire Racetracks, Ghost House and exhibition areas of over 40 wax - including wax of the famous singers, actors, scientists, leaders in the world...
Back to Da Nang for lunch.
In the afternoon, the coach will take you to visit Hoi An Old Town: Bridge Pagoda, Phung Hung Ancient House, Phuoc Kien Assembly Hall, Crafts establishments, then roam freely on the streets of colorful lanterns and buy souvenirs, test your skills in traditional games such as breaking earthen pot, Bai Choi singing.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.
Day 5 : DA NANG - HO CHI MINH CITY Meals included: 2 meals (Breakfast - Lunch)
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel.
Take a coach to My Khe Beach - one of the most charming beach in the planet (Depending on weather situation: from December to March annually, the tour does not the program of sea swimming because of cold weather).
Then visit the Ngu Hanh Son: Linh Ung Pagoda, Tang Chon Cave, Hoa Nghiem Cave, Non Nuoc Pagoda, Non Nuoc stone carving village.
Check out.
Have lunch.
Continue to take a look around the Son Tra Peninsula, visit the Linh Ung Pagoda - which has a statue of the tallest Guan Yin Buddha statue in Vietnam (67m), equivalent to a 30-floor building.
Standing here, you will admire the panoramic view of the city, mountain and Son Tra island in a perfect way.
Next, take a coach to the Da Nang airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.

In the afternoon, the coach takes you to visit Hoi An Old Town: Bridge Pagoda, Phung Hung Ancient House, Phuoc Kien Assembly Hall, Crafts establishments… then roam freely on the streets of colorful lanterns and buy souvenirs, test your skills in traditional games such as breaking earthen pot, Bai Choi singing, etc.
Have dinner.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.

On arrival in Hue

Enjoy dinner.

Here, you can admire the Da Nang's sightseeing with a new perspective that has never been explored.
In particular, with the impressive height of 115m, the Sun Wheel is currently in top 10 highest wheels in the world.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.

The relaxing pastoral services: go fishing, spa therapy with the natural ingredients, relax on the spacious lawn or lie in a hammock with the full of the creak of the green bamboo trees (at your own expense).
You also participate the lunch with the traditional dishes of the Vietnam countryside at Memento Resort.
Upon arrival in Nha Trang, check in and relax.

Stay overnight in Da Lat.
Day 4 : DA LAT - THE FLOWER CITY Meals included: 3 meals
You visit and conquer Langbiang Mountain - The roof of Central Highlands, have the panoramic view of mountain, Dankia lake, Suoi Vang with the meandering rivers seen from above (Go to the Mountain by Jeep car as a choice - At your own expense).
Continue to visit Golden Valley - An incredible combination of the typical features of Cu Hill and charming and attractive sceneries with the gardens, stone area, bonsai garden or artificial waterfall, etc.
In the afternoon, Bao Dai Private Residence (Dinh III) - The place where the family of final King in the feudal dynasties of Vietnam lived in and worked, is the next destination.
Pay a visit Da Lat Market and buy the local specialties.
Stay overnight in Da Lat.

Here you can conquer the challenge to slide the tube service to visit the falls (expenses excluded) Go to Ho Chi Minh City in the evening, the coach takes you to return the pick-up place.
The tour guide says goodbye to you and the tour ends.

Duration: 5 days
Departure: 07/04/2017 Other days
Place of departure: Ho Chi Minh City
Seat Availability: 9
8,090,000 VND

Accompanied service
Insurance
Meals
Guides
Sighseeing tickets

Tour program Tour details Note Contact Other days
Day 1 : HO CHI MINH - NOI BAI (HANOI) - LAO CAI - SAPA (Lunch - Dinner)
You are present at the Tan Son Nhat Airport, Column 4, Domestic Terminal.
The tour guide shall make the procedures to catch a flight to Hanoi.
Vietravel's coach shall pick you up at Noi Bai airport, and then depart to Sa Pa on the modern and longest highway in Vietnam, connecting Hanoi and Lao Cai through Vinh Phuc, Phu Tho, Yen Bai.
Upon arrial in Sapa, check in and free at leisure.
In the afternoon, visit the Ta Van - Lao Chai Village. The road into Ta Van is winding with a side of Muong Hoa valley with fertile terraced fields adorned by the green of maize and rice.
Upon arrival at Ta Van Village, visit the houses of the Mong, Dao, Giay ethnic groups, and surely you will be surprised at the idyllic, rustic beauty .
In the evening, go for a walk and admire Sapa Stone church, then enjoy regional specialties such as: grilled pork, baked eggs, Tao Meo wine (a kind of traditional wine), communication with ethnic people.
Stay overnight in Sapa.
Day 2 : SA PA – MAJESTIC FANSIPAN - LAO CAI (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Visit the Silver Falls, O Quy Ho Pass - the boundary between the two provinces of Lao Cai and Lai Chau winding around Hoang Lien Range, also known as the Heaven Gate.
Here, you can admire the panoramic picture of extremely majestic and impressive northwestern mountains from above.
Take a coach to visit and conquer the majestic Fansipan mountain (expense excluded) - which was named as "Roof of Indochina" with a height of 3.143m.
Here, you will travel by cable cars which currently owns 2 Guinness, including the longest three-rope cable system in the world (6.325m) and the greatest elevation difference (1,410 m).
In addition, at the station of departure, you can visit and make Buddhist ceremony at Trinh Temple or bless fortune, peace for the family at the Ha Temple at the station of arrival.
Besides, during the journey to conquer Fansipan mountain, you have opportunity to look at the ecosystems, Sapa vast mountain scenery beneath, which is also a great and unforgettable experience.
In the afternoon, climb the Ham Rong Mount for sightseeing and photography of Sapa town in fog, visit the blooming orchid garden, the central garden, watch the majestic Mount Fansipan, Heaven Gate, Thach Lam Dragon Head, Cloud Yard.
Return to Lao Cai and check in.
Freedom to explore the city at night.
Stay overnight in Lao Cai.
Day 3 : SA PA - LAO CAI - HANOI (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Check out, and then depart to Bac Ha.
On arrival, you shall blend into the exciting atmosphere of the mountainous market - Bac Ha Market, known as the largest mountainous market in Lao Cai, where gathered many traders in neighboring ethic groups for exchange, trade but Bac Ha is more famous by its natural beauty.
Continue to visit Hoang A Tuong Palace - also known as the "H'Mong's King's Palace" built from 1914 owned by Hoang Yen Chao - Tay ethnic group, Hoang A Tuong's father.
After nearly 100 years of existence, the old house still stands majestically outstanding between a densely populated place, crowded streets.
Return to Hanoi, check in.
In the evening, you are free to explore the old town at night.
Stay overnight in Hanoi.
Day 4 : HANOI - YEN TU - HA LONG (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Continue to visit and understand about the life and work of the father of the nation at the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum (it is not open for visiting on weekly Mondays and Fridays), Uncle Ho's Stilt House, Ho Chi Minh Museum, One Pillar Pagoda.
Then, visit the Temple of Literature where worships the Confucius and the Confucian sages - the first University of Vietnam.
Continue the journey to Halong, visit the Yen Tu Mountain (cable car costs excluded) - a natural attraction that was preserved with many historical sites and is known as "the land of Buddhism in Vietnam".
Then, visit the Hoa Yen Pagoda - a large and beautiful pagoda, situated on the halfway 516m in altitude, visit the Hue Quang Tower (Thap To).
Return to Ha Long in the afternoon, check in.
In the evening, take a coach to Bai Chay Bridge and then watch Ha Long City at night.
Return to the hotel, free at leisure or free to visit Tuan Chau Resort (expenses excluded), see circus performances of Dolphins, Seals .
Stay overnight in Ha Long.
Day 5 : HA LONG - (Cat Bi) HAI PHONG - HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast - Lunch)
Go to the wharf and take a cruise to go sightseeing in Ha Long Bay - a beautiful natural and extremely vivid scene, which was a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994.
Then, visit and explore the magnificence and luxury of the Heaven Palace Cave.
From the cruise, you can watch the islands in Halong Bay, including: Ga Choi Island, Lu Huong Island, etc.
Next, take a coach to the Cat Bi airport (Hai Phong) for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.

Tour program
Northwest of Vietnam: Nghia Lo - Tu Le - Mu Cang Chai - Yen Bai - Sapa - Dien Bien - Son La - Moc Chau - Happy Land
Tour code: NDSGN172-021-100317VJ-U
Duration: 6 days
Departure: 10/03/2017 Other days
Place of departure: Ho Chi Minh City
Seat Availability: 4
8,890,000 VND
BOOK NOW
Mu Cang Chai (Yen Bai) appears in the eyes of tourists with enchanting terraced rice paddies, beautiful mountain passes.
Like a brilliant mountain girl in the northwestern mountains and forests, Mu Cang Chai attracts tourists with wild, mountainous beauty.
Arriving in Mu Cang Chai, you also have the opportunity to learn unique features of Mong ethnic group with friendliness and hospitality.
Accompanied service
Insurance
Meals
Guides
Sighseeing tickets
Transport
Tour program Tour details Note Contact Other days
Day 1 : HO CHI MINH CITY - NOI BAI (HANOI) - YEN BAi - NGHIA LO (Lunch - Dinner)
Gather at Tan Son Nhat Airport, column 04 at the Domestic Terminal so that tour guide makes the procedures for you to catch a flight to Hanoi.
Vietravel's coach shall pick you up at Noi Bai Airport, then depart to Yen Bai.
Along the way, stop in Phu Tho to visit the Hung Temple.
On arrival, carry a thurible, visit Thuong Temple, Trung Temple, Ha Temple, Well of Pearls, King Hung Mausoleum, freely take photos and go shopping of souvenirs and then depart to Nghia Lo.
On arrival, check in and get rest at the hotel.
In the evening, enjoy the performances of Xoe dance, exchange and learn the characteristic culture of the Thai ethnic group.
Stay overnight in Nghia Lo.
Day 2 : NGHIA LO - MU CANG CHAI - SAPA (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Check out, depart to Mu Cang Chai, across Tu Le, you will smell the faintly fragrance of "new rice" along the wind from the roof chimney; this place is famous for sweet rice and grean rice.
To the Khau Pha Pass, you shall stop to take photos and watch the beautiful Lim Mong Village located at the foot of the pass.
This is a H'Mong village and a home to the most beautiful rice field in Mu Cang Chai.
Across the Khau Pha Pass to the territory of Mu Cang Chai, you will be enthralled by the bewitching beauty of terraced roads (Famous in 3 communes: La Pan Tan, Che Cu Nha and Ze Xu Phinh).
Then, admire the wide and out of sight valleys, cascading fields bending along mountain sides, mountains by mountains.
You can visit and enjoy the stages of rice season: sparkling water season on the slopes (February - March), rice transplanting season (May), the young rice season (June - July) and the most beautiful season - ripening season or gold season (September - October).
It is the also enthralling beauty in the ripening season, terraced fields in three communes were ranked as National Monument in 2007.
Upon arrival at the town of Mu Cang Chai, enjoy lunch and free at leisure.
In the afternoon, depart to Sapa, on the way, you shall stop to watch a panoramic view of dreaming Tan Uyen tea plantation and admire majestic landscapes of northwest mountains from O Quy Ho Pass - The boundary between two provinces Lao Cai and Lai Chau winding around the Hoang Lien Range, also known as the Heaven Gate.
On arrival in Sapa, check in and get rest at the hotel.
In the evening, you are free to visit the mountain town and enjoy special dishes here.
Stay overnight in Sa Pa.
Day 3 : SA PA - LAI CHAU (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Visit the Silver Falls, O Quy Ho Pass - the boundary between the two provinces of Lao Cai and Lai Chau winding around Hoang Lien Range, also known as the Heaven Gate.
Here, you can admire the panoramic picture of extremely majestic and impressive northwestern mountains from above.
Take a coach to visit and conquer the majestic Fansipan mountain (expense excluded) - which was named as "Roof of Indochina" with a height of 3.143m.
Here, you will travel by cable cars which currently owns 2 Guinness, including the longest three-rope cable system in the world (6.325m) and the greatest elevation difference (1,410 m).
In addition, at the station of departure, you can visit and make Buddhist ceremony at Trinh Temple or bless fortune, peace for the family at the Ha Temple at the station of arrival.
Besides, during the journey to conquer Fansipan mountain, you have opportunity to look at the ecosystems, Sapa vast mountain scenery beneath, which is also a great and unforgettable experience.
In the afternoon, Return to Lai Chau, check in and get rest.
Stay overnight in Lai Chau.
Day 4 : LAI CHAU - PHONG THO - MUONG LAY - DIEN BIEN (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
then depart to Dien Bien, and admire the northwest mountains and forests along the Nam Na River and wetlands formed by water rising of Son La hydroelectric plant at the confluence of: Da River, Nam Na River and Nam Rom River.
On arrival at Muong Lay, eat lunch.
Continue the journey to Dien Bien, visit the Dien Bien Phu Museum - Built in 1984 on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the historic victory of Dien Bien Phu, visit the Martyr's Cemetery in Hill A1, and A1 Hill, French military headquarters (General De Castries).
Stay overnight in Dien Bien.
Check in, enjoy dinner and stay overnight at Dien Bien.
Day 5 : DIEN BIEN - SON LA - MOC CHAU (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)
Check out, and then depart to Son LA.
Along the way, you will admire the majestic scenery of Northwest mountain from the peak of Pha Din Pass - One of the "big four pass" of Northwest region and ranked in most impressive group of 6 passes in Vietnam.
Upon arrival in Son La, have lunch.
Then, depart to Moc Chau.
Next, visit Dai Yem Waterfall - also called Nang Waterfall, in order to compare the soft beauty, seductive images of waterfalls with the beauty of young girls.
Then visit the Moc Chau Tea Hill - Standing on a tea hill, you will feel the fresh and cool air, at the same time witness the mist floating on, the tea roads running around the hill arranged in rows like the endlessly stretching green terraced fields.
You stop to go shopping of famous specialties made from fresh cow's milk of Moc Chau as a gift.
Check in and free at leisure.
Stay overnight in Moc Chau.
Day 6 : MOC CHAU - MAI CHAU - NOI BAI AIRPORT (HANOI) (Breakfast - Lunch)
Have breakfast at hotel and check out.
You visit Happy Land Moc Chau.
Depart to Hoa Binh and enjoy lunch.
Then, return to Hanoi, you shall take a coach to Noi Bai airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.

Day 4 : HANOI - YEN TU - HA LONG (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner)

Day 6 : NINH BINH - TRANG AN - HANOI - HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast - Lunch)
Check out, then visit the Bai Dinh Pagoda - a complex of structures on Bai Dinh Mountain known for Vietnam records such as the pagoda with the largest area, the largest bronze statues, most Arhat Buddha statues.
You can visit the Pagoda by trams.
Then, continue to Trang An Tourist Site - with natural charming scenery thanks to mountains and waters. Here, you will take a boat to visit the 3 spiritual points Trinh Temple, Tran Temple and Khong Palace (Phu Khong), through the caves as: Dark Cave, Bright Cave, Wine-making Cave, Three-drop Cave, etc.
Return to Hanoi, then take a coach to Noi Bai airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.
