Tour program
Dallas-Mexico-Cuba-Panama
Tour code: NNSGN763-03-260317AA-P
Duration: 13 days
Departure: 26/03/2017 Other days
Place of departure: Ho Chi Minh City
Seat Availability: 9
169,990,000 VND
BOOK NOW
Experience the best of Mexico’s rich history and spectacular ruins along with the vibrant history, traditions and rhythms of Cuba on this adventure of a lifetime. Be seduced by the wonder, sensuality and alluring fallen beauty that is Havana during a discovery of Cuba.
Accompanied service
Insurance
Meals
Guides
Sighseeing tickets
Transport
Tour program Tour details Note Contact Other days
Day 1 : HCMC - CANCUN (Dinner)
Vietravel's tour leader shall pick up Tourists at Tan Son Nhat airport to take a flight at 8:40 to Narita.
Transit 02 hours at Narita airport.
Then, connect a flight to Dallas, and again connect a flight to Cancun arriving at 21:23 on the same date, enjoy dinner and check in hotel to take rest after a long flight.
Day 2 : CANCUN (Three meals)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel.
The coach takes you to go on sightseeing and play at Xel Ha Park - the world's famous theme water park.
Xel Ha Park is located in the middle of the lagoons, a large estuary; where there is a large natural aquarium, in which the tropical fish and flora are abundant and diversified.
Water in this park is turquoise blue; is formed by the currents of the underground rivers mixed with salt water in the estuary All areas underwater in the park are fenced to prevent from sharks for safety of tourists.
Here, Tourists can lie to be drifted downstream, swimming with the shy and gentle natural creatures, or participate in funny aquatic sports.
Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant.
In the afternoon, you will depart to visit Tulum relics- a famous ruin of the Mayan.
Tulum City is surrounded by ancient citadels, built on a cliff with a panoramic view of the Caribbean.
Tulum charms tourists all around the worlds by its ancient beauty of thousands of years ago, by the ancient structures built by man power still exist until today, challenging time.
Back to Cancun to enjoy dinner and check in hotel to be free at leisure.
Day 3 : CANCUN - CHICHEN-ITZA - CANCUN (Three meals)
You will spend the whole morning discovering Chichen-Itza architectural ensemble, one of the world's seven new wonders.
Here is also the place where "composed" the calendar with the end of the 5,125 year cycle of the Mayan on 12 December 2012, the day was once believed to be doomsday.
Conquering the Mayan pyramid, built by the Mayan as a span between the divine and the human, visit the Temple of the Warriors, handball sport field "defend or die", where the losing captain will be beheaded after the end of the match.
Depart back to Cancun, on the way, you will call on for visiting and immersing in the sacred blue water of Cenote Ik Kil Lake - the product of tectonic processes lasting millions of years and considered a sacred place of the ancient Mayan and compared as the sacred lake fairyland of the Mayan.
This lake was totally situated about 20m underground.
This used to be a resort of the ancient Mayan as well as a supply of water for the ritual.
Back to Cancun to enjoy dinner and take rest.
Day 4 : CANCUN - LA HABANA (Three meals)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel.
Day 5 : LA HABANA (Three meals)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel.
Then depart to tour La Havana City - the Capital City of Cuba , one of the oldest cities in the Western Hemisphere.
Habana was built in baroque and neoclassical style, recognized by UNESCO as the World Cultural Heritage in 1982.
This tour takes you to the main points in the city, including Old Havana district and modern Havana areas.
You begin the program with the visit to the historic district with the General Captian Museum, La Bodeguita del Medio - a famous restaurant in Havana visited by many tourists.
Visit Plaza de Arms and San Francisco Square, Church Cathedral in Havana with ancient architecture and considered a famous religious works.
You will have the chance to feel the atmosphere of the narrow cobble streets of Old Havana district, admire the old colonial buildings dated from 16th century.
Call on Ambos Mundos hotel, this is the place where the great famous writer Ernest Hemingway of the U.S lived and worked when he visited Cuba.
Lounging in Obispo, Tourists are easily intoxicated by the loveliness of this pedestrian street.
Here is concentrated with many local stores for you to buy a variety of gifts.
Lunch at local restaurant, you will be able to taste Mojito - famous cocktail made from rum of Cuba.
Afternoon, you stop at the Rum Museum to see the wine production process, local crafts market. Visit El Morro Fortress– where defended the estuary inhere.
Stroll the coastal city of Casablanca before dinner at a local restaurant and back to hotel to take rest.
Day 6 : LA HABANA – CIENFUEGOS - TRINIDAD (Three meals)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel.
Depart to Trinidad city.
On the way, call on for visiting Zapata Peninsula located on the historical Bay of Pigs, where has the largest wetlands of the Caribbean, and a habitat of 175 species of birds, 31 species of reptiles, especially flamingos and alligators and thousands of other invertebrates.
Visit the cold war Museum of the Bay of Pigs battle.
Tourists have lunch on the way.
Stop at Cienfuegos city to enjoy lunch.
Then, visit the city, recognized as the World's Heritage Site by the UNESCO in 2004.
This is a best model for Urban Planning of the "era of light" of Spain in early 19th century with square streets aligned straight like a chessboard.
Visit Marti Park located right at the the Historical Center as the symbol oft this City.
It has still remained the old architectures of French style since the time of colonial settlers.
Visit Valle Palace, Marti Park and Tomas Terry Theater, Cathedral.
Then, the coach continues to take you to Trinidad City.
On arrival, you will enjoy dinner, then back to check in hotel and free at leisure.
Day 7 : TRINIDAD – SANTA CLARA – LA HABANA (Three meals)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel.
Tourists will spend the all day visiting Trinidad city, one of the first villages established by the Spanish in the 16th century and recognized as the World Heritage Site in 1988 by the UNESCO.
Trinidad is famous for its cobbled streets and houses painted pastel color, with the magnificent buildings and shopping malls.
Start the tour with visiting Main Square, Central Square, Holy Trinity Church and Romantic Museum.
Canchanchara bar and Iznaga Tower.
Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant.
In the afternoon, Tourists are taken by coach to the city of Santa Clara, where the victory of the Cuban Revolution lead by Ernesto "Che" Guevara and Camilo Cienfeugous took place.
Here, you will call on the monument in honor of Che Guevara - the national hero of Cuba, his Tomb and the Museum storing memorabilia in the life of Che.
Vidal Park, “Armored Train”.
In the afternoon, Tourists are back to La Habana and enjoy dinner at a local restaurant.
After dinner, you will be back to hotel and free at leisure.
Day 8 : LA HABANA - PANAMA (Three meals)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel.
Visit Ernest Hemingway museum located in a large precinct having a swimming pool, on a hill of San Francisco de Paula Village is a house where Hemingway used to live for 20 years.
At the end of the garden, You are introduced the Pilar fishing boat of the writer.
To end the journey tracing Hemingway, Tourists will walk to the fishing village of Cojimar, where Hemingway's boat used to moor and where inspired him to write "The Old Man and the Sea".
A stature of the writer was also erected in here.
Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant.
Then visit the outside of Capitolio Nacional - where used to be Cuba's parliamentary house until after the 1959 reform period.
The building design makes many humorous persons compared as "twin" with the United States Capitol in Washington DC - USA.
Then depart to airport to take a flight to Panama - Apart from the world-famous canal, the Panama also hides many historical, cultural and natural sights attracting tourists.
After entry procedures, you will enjoy dinner at a local restaurant and check in hotel to either be free at leisure or discover Panama at night.
Day 9 : MIRAFLORES LOCKS - PEDRO MIGUEL LOCKS (Three meals)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel.
Then spend the all day visiting and discovering Panama City, one of the destinations attracting the most visitors.
Take part in a tour discovering the operation process of Panama canal.
Panama Canal comprises of 3 locks, namely Gatun lock, Pedro Miguel Lock and Miraflores locks, It takes about 9 hours to pass through the canals, but in the journey of the day, you will go one section of it, through Pedro Miguel lock and Miraflores lock.
However, in the meantime you will have contemplation and take photo of the beautiful surrounding landscape.
Continue to visit Casco Viejo - a quarter with captivating ancient buildings and historical sites.
Casco Viejo was once ravaged by the urbanization of the city of Panama, forgotten and quickly became slums.
However, these ancient buildings have been restored.
By the efforts of the international community, Casco Viejo was recognized as the World Heritage Site by the UNESCO in 2003.
After dinner, Tourists will be either free at leisure or discover the city.
Day 10 : EMBERA MEETING POINT - PANAMA VEIJO (Three meals)
Breakfast at hotel.
Depart to Embara meeting point, boarding the Piragua (dugout boat) and travel along Charges river to the Embera Indian Village.
Here, you will have a chance to learn about the culture and join in many interesting activities.
Lunch at local restaurant.
In the afternoon, depart back to Panama city, visit Panama Veijo - former capital of the country featured with historically significant ruins.
After that, free for shopping in Panama.
Dinner and free at leisure.
Day 11 : PANAMA - LOS ANGELES (Breakfast, Dinner)
Enjoy breakfast at hotel and check-out.
The coach takes you to the airport to take a flight back to Los Angeles.
On arrival, complete entry procedure, free to visit and go shopping in Los Angeles till the time of gathering to airport to take a flight back to Vietnam (Transit in Japan). Overnight on the board.
Day 12 : Crossing the international date line
Day 13 : HO CHI MINH CITY
On arrival at Tan Son Nhat airport at 9:50 am, Vietravel's coach will pick you up and take you back to 190 Pasteur, District 3, HCMC.
End of the trip.

Bhutan: Discover the happiest country world- the first day of tet
Tour code: NNSGN972-003-200317VN-U
Duration: 7 days
Departure: 20/03/2017 Other days
Place of departure: Ho Chi Minh City
Seat Availability: 9
64,990,000 VND
BOOK NOW
In this new journey, Vietravel wants to introduce to you the best features of the land known as "the City of the Clouds", "the happiest country in the world" by the route combining riding and walking on foot in the remote villages of the "Kingdom of the Thunder Dragon", visit the ancient temples and monasteries located in the high mountains to feel the sense of peace and distinguish life of the people of Bhutan from other lands.
Accompanied service
Insurance
Meals
Guides
Sighseeing tickets
Transport
Tour program Tour details Note Contact Other days
Day 1 : HO CHI MINH CITY – BANGKOK
Vietravel's coach and tour guide shall pick you up at 190 Pasteur, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City and take you to Tan Son Nhat Airport to catch a flight to Bangkok.
On arrival, get on the coach to go the hotel for rest.
Stay overnight in Bangkok
Day 2 : BANGKOK - PARO - THIMPHU (55 km) (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
In the early morning, after check out, go to the airport to catch a flight to the only airport of Bhutan at Paro valley.
You will have the opportunity to enjoy the panoramic view one of the world's highest mountains through the window of airplane.
Go to the Paro airport, the tour guide will make the entry procedures to Bhutan for you.
After completing entry procedures to "the land of Thunder Dragon", you get on the coach to go toThimphu - Bhutan's capital, located in the western part of Bhutan at an altitude of about 2,300 meters.
The city is located in the fertile valley of Thimphu River, and characterized by a blend of tradition and modernity.
On arrival, you begin the journey to explore the city with:
- National Memorial Chorten: has the stunning architecture to commemorate the 3rd king of Bhutan, the "father of modern Bhutan".
Chorten was built with the purpose as a place to pray for peace and prosperity.
The patterns on the ceilings inside and surrounding statues are imbued with philosophy of Bhutan.
- Dordenma Buddhas Statue: made of gold and copper, is one of the world's tallest statue with a height of about 51m.
In the heart of Buddha statues includes 125,000 small Buddha statues and a hall.
Located on a hilltop, so you can enjoy the panoramic view of Thimphu City from here.
- Motithang Takin Preserve: where protects Takin - a goat-antelope associated with the legend on Divine Madman- Drukpa Kuenlay on the Himalayas is on the verge of extinction.
- Weekend markets (open on the weekly Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays): is an opportunity to learn about the daily life and the everyday images of the Bhutan people.
Here you can buy agricultural products and unique local souvenirs.
- Textile factory: Where you can admire the unique and characteristic brocatelle products weaved by craftsman of Bhutan.
- Handicrafts Emporium: is run by the government, which showcases a lot of handmade and embroidery products.
- Tashicho Dzong monastery (Thimphu Dzong) is the fortress monastery located in the north Thimphu on the banks of the Wang Chhu River.
Built in 1641 by Shabdrung Ngawang Namgyal, this place is called "Fortress of the glorious religion".
Currently, this fortress is the administrative agency of the state, where dwells the King's room, and a lot of agencies under the managing apparatus of the state.
This is also the dwelling place in the summer of Buddhist leaders.
Enjoy dinner and check in, get at the hotel or be free to explore the city on the night
Day 3 : THIMPHU (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast at the hotel, you shall visit the Jigme Dorji Wild Zoo, where nurtures wildlife of the country.
The zoo is home to some rare wildlife such as Takin - a goat-antelope associated with the legend on Divine Madman- Drukpa Kuenlay on the Himalayas that is on the verge of extinction, snow leopard, blue sheep, tiger, red panda, Himalayan black bears and more than 300 species of birds living here naturally.
After visiting the zoo,you walk on foot from the Dodena village to visit the Goemba Cheri monastery, a small hilltop monastery with high status to see the panorama of the Thimphu valley.
It is a very sacred place because it stores the holy ash of Tempi Nima, father of the first saint of the Buddhism in Bhutan.
Also a lot of paintings on the saints of Buddhism in Bhutan are preserved here.
After visiting the monastery, you take the coach back to the old path, to see the natural sights of this sacred place.
After returning to Dodena Village, you will have a picnic meal next to fresh Thimphu river.
Later, you take a coach back to Thimphu through small roads crossing the simple villages.
Eat dinner and enjoy a special cultural program.
Here, you can visit, go shopping the Cordyceps sinensis- a rare Oriental medicine since ancient times with functions to enhance the immune system and a positive effect on the cardiovascular system, respiratory, endocrine, etc.
Located in the south of Himalayas, Bhutan is one of the places to offer the best cordyceps in the world with quality controlled strictly by the Ministry of Agriculture.
Then, free at leisure.
Day 4 : THIMPHU - PUNAKHA (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast at the hotel.
You start on a journey to explore the 3,100 meter high Dochula Pass to watch the sun rise from the east, from here you can zoom eye to the north to watch the majestic Himalayas.
As many as 108 towers are scattered, towards the Himalayas representing108 the Buddha's teachings.
According to the legend, the Dochula tower was built to repel a demon often catching people at Dochula Pass - the pass connecting the Thimphu capital with the eastern Bhutan.
After the tour, you get on the coach to Punakha - once the capital and political center of the Government of Bhutan until 1955.
Located at an altitude of 1,200 meters over sea level, unlike the Thimpu, Punakha's weather is relatively warm in the winter and quite hot in summer.
Thanks to the temperate climate plus natural drainage system from the two rivers of Mo Pho and Chhu Chhu, Punakha has not only green rice fields, but also abundant fruits.
You visit the following sites:
- Punakha Dzong Fortress: was built in 1637 by Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel, the founder of the state of Bhutan.
Initially, this fortress was named the Dechen Phodrang Dzong Puntang, which means Palace of Great Bliss.
This fortress is the oldest and largest in Bhutan.
Punakha Dzong is the administrative center and the headquarter of the Government of Bhutan until 1955, when the capital was moved to Thimpu.
- The Khamsum Yulley Namgyal Chorten - a Stupa built by the third Queen, Ashi Tshering Yangdon Wangchuck in 2000 and is a great testament to the Chorten art of Tantric Buddhism in Bhutan.
You will walk about 30 minutes from the parking across a suspension bridge and fields with wild landscapes.
Have lunch and dinner at a local restaurant.
Check in and get rest at the hotel.
Day 5 : PUNAKHA - PARO (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
After breakfast and check out, you go to Paro historic town with sacred sites and ancient buildings scattered everywhere.
In addition, this town was located in the vast Paro valley, which is recognized as one of the most beautiful valleys in Bhutan.
Here, you will have the opportunity to be immersed in nature and enjoy the peaceful beauty of this country.
Paro and Punakha with Jakar, has formed a golden triangle tour in Bhutan:
- Rinpung Dzong - One of the largest monasteries of Paro, where enforcement agencies and provincial authorities are located.
Name of Rinpung Dzong Fortress means literally lying on piles of treasure.
To come to Dzong, you will come across an ancient bridge called Nemi Zam.
- Kyichu Lhakhang: As one of the two oldest and most sacred temples in Bhutan and built in the 7th century.
Kyichu Lhakhang is a combination of two temples: The first temple was built by King Songtsen Gampo of Tibet in the 7th century.
In 1968, Ashi Kesang - Queen Mother of Bhutan has built the second temple next to the first temple in the same style.
- Visit the Dungtse Lhakhang Temple - a small temple but very unique architecture in Bhutan.
Have lunch and dinner at a local restaurant.
Stay overnight at the hotel
Day 6 : PARO – TIGER'S NEST MONASTERY (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner)
You have breakfast at the hotel.
You will visit Taktsang Monastery (Tiger’s Nest) in a whole day: this is one of the famous monasteries in Bhutan, built on an 900m high steep cliff above the Paro valley.
According to the legend, long years ago, the Padmasambhava rode on the back of a tigress, came here and sit meditation in this place.
Since then, this place has become a holy place of the people of Bhutan, one of the important pilgrimage which Bhutanese citizens must try to go at least once in their lifetime.
(To reach Taktsang Monastery, you have to climb about 3 hours - you can ride on a horse, go up about 2/3 of the way (expenses excluded) then to walk and climb about 850 stairs to get to the gate; go on foot in downwards).
Have lunch and dinner at a local restaurant.
Stay overnight at the hotel.
Day 7 : PARO - BANGKOK - HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast - Lunch)
You have breakfast at the hotel.
You get on the coach to the Paro international airport to catch the flight to Vietnam, transit in Bangkok.
Arrive in Tan Son Nhat Airport, Vietravel's coach and tour guide shall pick up and take you to 190 Pasteur, Ward 6, District 3.
End the interesting tour.

THE SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIET NAM
Mainland Territory: 330,951.1 sq.km
Population: 88,772.9 thousand inhabitants (Apr.2012)
National Capital: Ha Noi
Lying on the eastern part of the Indochinese peninsula, Viet Nam is a strip of land shaped like the letter “S”. China borders it to the north, Laos and Cambodia to the west, the East Sea to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the east and south.
The coastline is 3,260km long and the inland border is 4,510km.
The country’s total length from north to south is 1,650km. Its width, stretching from east to west, is 600km at the widest point in the north, 400km in the south, and 50km at the narrowest part, in the centre, in Quang Binh Province.
Latitude: 102º 08' - 109º 28' east
Longitude: 8º 02' - 23º 23' north
Viet Nam is also a transport junction from the Indian Ocean to the Pacific Ocean.
Climate: Viet Nam lies in the tropics and monsoon (detail)
Topography: Three quarters of Viet Nam's territory consist of mountains and hills (detail)
Administrative Units: Viet Nam is divided into 63 provinces and cities.
Climate
Viet Nam
Cat Cat Village (Sa Pa, Lao Cai Province)
The annual average temperatures range from 22oC to 27oC.
Every year there are 100 rainy days and the average rainfall is 1,500 to 2,000mm.
The humidity ranges around 80%.
In general, in Viet Nam there are two seasons, the cold season occurs from November to April and the hot season from May to October.
There are essentially four distinct seasons, which are most evident in the northern provinces(from Hai Van Pass toward to the north): Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter.
Sa Pa Ancient Rock Field (Lao Cai Province)
Ha Noi
Hoan Kiem Lake (Ha Noi)
In Ha Noi there are four distinct seasons: Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter.
The annual average temperature is 23.2oC, but in winter the average temperature is 17.2oC.
Hai Phong
Tam Bac Lake (Hai Phong City)
It's one province in the North then Hai Phong is influenced by a tropical monsoon climate too. There are 4 seasons and the annual average temperature is between 23oC and 24oC. Rainfall total is between 1,600 and 1,800mm. The weather is warm throughout the year.
Quang Ninh
Thua Thien Hue
Perfume River (Hue Ctiy)
It features a tropical monsoon climate, featuring all four distinct seasons: spring, summer, autumn and winter. The spring is cool and warm, the summer is hot, the autumn is cool and the winter is cold.
Average temperature is 25oC.
The best time for tourists is from November to April next year.
Da Nang
Its climate is tropical, with two distinct rainy and dry seasons.
The average annual temperature is between 28oC and 29oC, and storms hit the area every year in September and October.
Khanh Hoa
The climate here is oceanic tropical monsoon, but is quite mild.
The average annual temperature is 26.5oC.
Annual rainfall totals over 1,200mm.
Lam Dong
Love Valley (Da Lat City, Lam Dong Province)
Ho Chi Minh City
Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee Building
The climate is divided into two seasons, with the rainy season lasting from May to November.
The average annual temperature is 27.5oC without winter, and yearly rainfall totals 1,979mm.
Tourism is convenient for all 12 months of the year.
Ba Ria-Vung Tau
The climate here is tropical monsoon.
The average annual temperature is 27oC, rarely stormy, rich in sunshine.
Country's official name
At the beginning of the Bronze Age, the Viet tribe groups had settled down in the North and in the north of Central Viet Nam.
There were about 15 groups of Lac Viet tribesmen living mainly in the northern highland and delta and a dozen Au Viet groups of tribesmen living in Viet Bac, the northern region of old Viet Nam.
♦ Van Lang (2876 BC – 258 BC)
At that time, the two ethnic tribes of the Lac Viet and Au Viet lived together in many areas with other inhabitants.
Based on historical documents, researchers correlatively delineated the location of Van Lang Nation to the present day regions of North and north of Central Vietnam, as well as the south of present-day Kwangsi (China).
♦ Au Lac (257 BC – 207 BC)
In 221 BC, Qin Shihuangdi (Tan Thuy Hoang), King of Qin (China), invaded the land of the Viet tribes.
Thuc Phan, the leader of the alliance of Au-Viet tribes was respected as the chief of the resistance war against the Tan enemy that later, in 208 BC, was forced to withdraw.
With his imposing power, Thuc Phan nominated himself as King An Duong Vuong and founded Au Lac Nation with groups of Lac Viet and Au Viet tribes.
In 207 BC, Trieu Da, King of Nam Viet (China), invaded Au Lac country.
The resistance of An Duong Vuong failed soon after this invasion.
As a result, the northern feudalist took turns dominating the country over the next seven centuries, establishing their harsh regime in the country and dividing the country into administrative regions and districts with unfamiliar names. However, the country’s name of Au Lac could not be erased from the people’s minds in their everyday life.
♦ Van Xuan (544-602)
In the spring of 542, Ly Bi rose up in arms and swept away the Chinese administration, liberating the territory.
He declared himself King of Van Xuan Kingdom in February 544, acknowledging the national superiority complex of the independent spirits to live in eternal peace.
However, the existence of Ly Bi’s administration was very brief. He was defeated by the Chinese imperial army, and the country returned to feudal Chinese domination again in 602.
The name Van Xuan was restored only after the victory over the Han army at the Bach Dang River led by General Ngo Quyen in 938. This victory marked the end of the Chinese domination period in Viet Nam.
♦ Dai Co Viet (968 – 1054)
In 968, Dinh Bo Linh defeated the twelve lords and unified the country. He declared himself King and named the country Dai Co Viet.
This name remained throughout the Dinh Dynasty (968-980), Pre-Le Dynasty (980-1009) and the beginning of Ly Dynasty (1010-1225).
♦ Dai Viet (1054 – 1802)
In 1054, a flaming bright star appeared in the sky for many days, which was considered a good omen. As a result, the King Ly changed the name of the country to Dai Viet. This name remained until the end of Tran Dynasty (1126 - 1400).
The name Dai Viet remained under the Le Dynasty (1428-1788) and the Tay Son Dynasty (1788-1802).
♦ Dai Ngu (1400 – 1406)
In March 1400, Ho Quy Ly usurped the throne of King Tran Thieu De, founded the Ho Dynasty and changed the country’s name to Dai Ngu, meaning peace in the ancient language.
This name only lasted for very short time, until April 1407, when the Ming enemy invaded Dai Ngu and defeated the Ho Dynasty (1400- 1407).
♦ Viet Nam
In 1802, Nguyen Anh claimed his coronation to become the first King Nguyen, starting the Nguyen dynasty and changing the country’s name to Viet Nam. This name was officially recognized in many diplomatic missions in 1804.
However, the words "Viet Nam" had already appeared very early in history.
In the 14th century, there was a book of code entitled "Viet Nam the Chi", edited by Doctor Ho Tong Thoc.
In the book by scholar Nguyen Trai entitled "Du Dia Chi" at the beginning of 15th century; the words "Viet Nam" were repeated several times.
Doctor Trinh Nguyen Binh Khiem (1491-1585) had written on the first page of his work "Trinh Tien Sinh Quoc Ngu" the following: "...
Viet Nam have constructed its foundation..." The words "Viet Nam" were also found in some carved stelae of the 16th - 17th century in Bao Lam Pagoda, Haiphong (1558), in Cam Lo Pagoda, Ha Noi (1590), in Phuc Thanh Pagoda, Bac Ninh (1664), etc.
In particular, in the first sentence on the stele Thuy Mon Dinh (1670) at the landmark on the border at Lang Son, it was written: "This is the gateway of Viet Nam that guards the northern frontiers..." 
In terms of meaning, there are many theories that prove the words "Viet Nam" are created by combining two racial and geographic elements, which is understood as "Viet people from the south".
During the reign of King Minh Mang (1820-1840), the name of the country was changed to Dai Nam, but Viet Nam was still widely used in many literary works, civil business affairs, and social relations.
Following the triumph of the August Revolution on August 19th 1945, which had entirely swept away Vietnamese feudal and French colonial oppression and began a new era in the country, President Ho Chi Minh proclaimed the nation’s independence and the national name Democratic Republic of Viet Nam was born on September 2nd 1945.
Although Viet Nam suffered from war and separation in the following 30 years, the sacred words "Viet Nam" were very popularly used from the North to the South, and were deeply imprinted in the hearts of the Vietnamese people.
Following the liberation of Southern Viet Nam on April 30 1975, the entire country of Viet Nam was completely unified.
In the first meeting of the National Assembly of the Unified Viet Nam on July 2nd 1976, the assembly decided to name the country The Socialist Republic of Viet Nam.
The constitution of 1980, and 1992, continued its affirmation of the country’s official name, legally and actually.
Prehistoric Era
Prehistoric Era of Viet Nam include: Pre-Paleolithic Age and Neolithic Age.
♦ Pre-Paleolithic Age
Human civilization started in Viet Nam a very long time ago.
In fact, archaeologists have found vestiges of Homo Erectus in the caves of Lang Son and Nghe An Provinces.
During the Pre-Paleolithic Age, also known as the Son Vi Era, the population of Viet Nam was rather large and widespread.
♦ Neolithic Age
The people used sophisticated trimmed stone axes.
Foundation of the Nation
Metal Age (about 4,000 years ago):
Vietnam existed three major cultural centers: Phung Nguyen - Dong Son (The North), Long Thanh - Sa Huynh (The Centre) and Cau Sat, Doc Chua - Dong Nai (The South) from Bronze Age to Iron Age.
These three major cultural centers had close and long mutual relationship, contributed to specific traditional culture of Viet Nam.
It's unity in abundance.
♦ Van Lang Nation
Hung Vuong Museum (Phu Tho Province)
♦ Au Lac Nation
A few centuries later, An Duong Vuong founded the Au Lac Nation in the third century BC.
Records of this nation can be found in the annals written by the Chinese historian, Xi Ma Tin.
Remains of the Co Loa Citadel, which was built during the An Duong Vuong period, can still be seen today.
Co Loa Ancient Citadel (Ha Noi)
♦ Champa Nation
The Pre-Sa Huynh culture evolved in South Central Viet Nam during the Iron Age.
The people of this group lived between Thua Thien and the Dong Nai River Delta.
The Sa Huynh culture was founded by the ancestors of the Cham who founded the Champa Kingdom.
Champa Culture
Chinese domination period (1st century, BC - 10th century, AD)

VNAT to promote Viet Nam’s tourism in China
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) will organize roadshow to promote Viet Nam’s tourism in Nanning, Fuzhou, Nanjing and Hefei cities, China from 11-20 May 2017.
China is one of the most largest source markets in the world.
According to China National Tourism Administration, in 2016, the number of China’s outbound tourists reached 122 million and total consumption reached $109.8 billion.
China is listed in the top leading markets sending tourists to Viet Nam. In 2016, Viet Nam welcomed 2,696,848 Chinese tourist arrivals, increasing by 51.4% over 2015, accounting for 27% of the total number of international tourist arrivals to Viet Nam.
The roadshow in China is part of the national tourism promotion program in 2017.
The roadshow is expected to attract the participation of numerous Chinese travel enterprises and media agencies.
Viet Nam wows international bloggers
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On 28 April 2017, in Ha Noi, Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) held a meeting with international bloggers after their trip exploring Ha Noi and Kong: Skull Island’s filming locations in Viet Nam.
Sharing his feeling, German blogger Longin Beznhard said that this trip was absolutely interesting and unexpected for them. They were totally impressed by the fascinating landscapes of Ha Noi, Ninh Binh, Quang Ninh and Quang Binh.
In the coming time, Viet Nam should keep promoting tourism via Hollywood blockbusters.
Speaking at the meeting, Mr.Ngo Hoai Chung – Vice Chairman of VNAT warmly welcomed the international bloggers on their visit to Viet Nam.
He emphasized that Kong: Skull Island brought Viet Nam a golden opportunity to popularize tourism.
He also informed the American director Jordan Vogt-Roberts has officially named Viet Nam’s Tourism Ambassador by the Vietnamese Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.
Thanks to the positive influences of the film, tours “Following Kong’s footprint” has become very attractive to travellers within the country and overseas.
He hoped that after this trip the international bloggers would share their experiences about Viet Nam with their friends and international community, which would help further promote Viet Nam to the public and attract more visitors to Viet Nam.
International bloggers visit Kong: Skull Island’s filming locations in Viet Nam
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On 22 April 2017, Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) organized a welcome party for international bloggers to Viet Nam.
From 22-28 April, the group of 11 bloggers from Germany, France, Italy, Japan, Singapore, Indonesia and Taiwan will visit Ha Noi and some tourist spots in the provinces of Quang Ninh, Ninh Binh and Quang Binh - the filming locations of the blockbuster movie “Kong: Skull Island”.
At the meeting, Mr.Dinh Ngoc Duc - Director of Tourism Marketing Department (VNAT) expressed his pleasure to welcome the bloggers to Viet Nam.

On the first day in Viet Nam, the bloggers visited some famous attractions of Ha Noi such as Ngoc Son Temple, Thang Long Royal Citadel, Temple of Literature and enjoyed specialties as egg coffee, shrimp cake, spring roll...
The bloggers were very impressed with beautiful landscapes and delicious cuisine of Ha Noi.
After Ha Noi, the bloggers will move to Ha Long Bay (in Quang Ninh), Ninh Binh and Quang Binh and come back to Ha Noi on 28 April.
VNAT works with Finnish University Hub Project
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On 21 April, Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism’s (VNAT’s) Vice Chairwoman Nguyen Thi Thanh Huong had a meeting with Mr.Jouni Ahonen – Vice Rector of Haaga-Helia University of Applied Sciences (Finland), representative of Finnish University Hub Project.
The Finnish University Hub Project financed by Finnish Government aims at pursuing Viet Nam to set up a training centre which consists of English and Finnish language studies, basic academic studies; besides introduce Finland’s culture and economy.
The project also provides programs in preparation for Vietnamese students coming to Finland for bachelor’s or master’s studies.
Speaking at the meeting, Mr.Jouni Ahonen said they would like to study the demand for tourism occupational training and seek opportunity to cooperate with Viet Nam tourism industry.
Spoke highly of the Finnish University Hub Project in Viet Nam, VNAT’s Vice Chairwoman Nguyen Thi Thanh Huong stressed that Viet Nam always focuses on training high-quality human resource.
Currently, Viet Nam has many tourism training establishments and about 5,000 people involving tourism training activities, including 2,000 lecturers.
Vice Chairwoman Nguyen Thi Thanh Huong informed that Viet Nam is striving to develop tourism into a spearhead economic sector. Hence, there is a high demand for high-quality human resource.
The Project should collaborate with tourism occupational training facilities in Viet Nam to choose potential students for further training, which would help improve quality of tourism working force in Viet Nam.
VNAT’s Chairman Nguyen Van Tuan works with Korea Tourism Organization
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On 9 April 2017, Chairman of Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT), Mr.Nguyen Van Tuan had a meeting with President of Korea Tourism Organization (KTO), Mr.Jung Chang Soo.
According to Mr.Jung Chang Soo, marking the celebration of 25th Anniversary of Viet Nam – Korea diplomatic ties, various activities will take place in both two countries this year.
Of which, the starting event was the “Korea Days in Ha Noi 2017’’ from April 8-9.
In 2016, there were 1.5 million Korean visitors to Viet Nam and 250,000 Vietnamese visitors to Korea.
The Korea’s tourism sector highly valued tourist potential from Viet Nam and hoped to enhance the bilateral cooperation, Mr.Jung Chang Soo said.
Speaking at the meeting, VNAT’s Chairman Nguyen Van Tuan said that the number of Vietnamese visitors to Korea would increase in the coming time thanks to the effective cooperation between the tourism enterprises of Viet Nam and Korea and the positive influence of Korean cinema.
Chairman Nguyen Van Tuan proposed that Republic of Korea should loosen visa policy for Vietnamese tourists, for example apply visa exemption for Vietnamese tourist clients of some Vietnamese reputable travel agencies.
At the meeting, Chairman Nguyen Van Tuan also informed that Viet Nam received over 10 million int’l visitors in 2016, representing the growth of 26%.
Of the total, Chinese and Korean markets made the largest contribution, accounting for 27% and 15%, respectively.
In the first three months of 2017, the number of Korean visitors to Viet Nam reached 500,000 arrivals, and is expected to reach 2 million this year.
Republic of Korea has been considered as one of the leading tourist markets of Viet Nam tourism. VNAT would continue to strengthen cooperation with KTO in organizing cultural and tourism exchange activities, boost the number of tourists to the two countries.
At the Korea World Travel Fair (KOTFA) due in this June, Viet Nam will organize a series of activities to promote Viet Nam tourism to the Korean public.

Ms. Pham Le Thao - Deputy Director of Travel Department (VNAT) speaking at the opening ceremony of the program
VNAT’s delegation led by Ms.Pham Le Thao – Deputy Director of Travel Department will participate in exchange and training activities on tourism development cooperation, including seminars of “Viet Nam – China tourism cooperation”, “Human resource management in tourism enterprises”, “Overview of Yunnan tourism”, “Multinational tourism cooperation – Rule and policy”, and so on;

Consultation meeting on updating the GMS Tourism Strategy
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On 13 September 2016, in Ha Noi, Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) in collaboration with Mekong Tourism Coordinating Office (MTCO) organized the Consultation meeting on updating the Greater Mekong Sub-region (GMS) Tourism Strategy.
In his speech, Mr.Ha Van Sieu – Deputy Director General of VNAT appreciated that the Tourism Working Group and MTCO successfully implemented Tourism Strategy 2005-2015.
In 2015, GMS welcomed 57.8 million international tourist arrivals, 5.6 million higher than the planned number of 52.2 million; total tourism receipts reached USD 63.7 billion, increasing by USD 11.3 billion comparing to the target of USD 52.4 billion.
He also emphasized that the revised strategy should take into account development situation, opportunities and challenges of the sub-region; be appropriate with ASEAN tourism development strategy and plan; and encourage the participation of private sector, partner countries, international organizations in implementing GMS Tourism Strategy.
According to Dr.Walter Jamieson – a GMS tourism expert, the draft strategy for the new period includes strategic directions of:
Development of human resource;
Tourism infrastructure development;
Enhancing responsible service and experience;
Implementing creative tourism marketing and promotion campaigns;
Travel facilitation within the sub-region.
At the meeting, the participants discussed the vision, strategic directions, coherence between tourism development strategy of Viet Nam and GMS, involvement of business community and donors in implementing the strategy…
The meetings held in Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar, Thailand, Viet Nam and China aim to consult these countries about updating GMS Tourism Strategy 2016-2025.
Promoting tourism cooperation between Viet Nam and Japan
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On 9 September 2016, Japan Association of Travel Agents (JATA) organized a seminar to promote tourism cooperation between Viet Nam and Japan.
In his speech, Mr.Ngo Hoai Chung – Deputy Director General of VNAT emphasized that Viet Nam tourism has identified Japan as one of the key source markets.
In recent years, Japan has ranked in top 5 leading source markets.
In 2015, Viet Nam welcomed 671,000 Japanese tourist arrivals, up 3.6% over 2014.
In 8 months of 2016, this number reached 482,358, up 12.1% over the same period last year.
The number of Vietnamese tourists to Japan has constantly increased in recent years with 185,000 arrivals in 2015 (+49%) and 122,836 arrivals in 6 months of 2016.
Tourism cooperation between Viet Nam and Japan has increasingly been tightened, especially after the approval of joint statement on tourism cooperation between the two countries in 2005 and the establishment of Viet Nam-Japan Tourism Cooperation Committee.
The two sides have supported each other in organizing promotional activities.
Annually, Viet Nam participated in JATA Tourism Expo, holding various workshops and roadshows to promote Viet Nam tourism to Japanese public, welcomed Japanese famtrips and presstrips…
At the seminar, Mr.Chung proposed Japan to waive visa for Vietnamese citizens to boost tourists exchange between the two countries.
Viet Nam has exempted visa for Japanese visitors since 2014.
To strengthen tourism cooperation in the coming time, the two sides should focus on boosting tourists exchange, developing human resources, investment in tourism development, travel facilitation and tourism promotion.

VNAT introduces source markets of North America, Australia and New Zealand
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – In the framework of International Travel Expo 2016 (ITE-HCMC 2016), on 9 September 2016, in Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) organized seminars on outbound tourism markets of North America, Australia and New Zealand.
In his speech, Mr.Ha Van Sieu – Deputy Director General of VNAT emphasized the importance of market research and called for closer cooperation of business community, localities and researchers with VNAT in terms of market research and sharing information for tourism promotion.

Views:

The delegation led by Deputy Director General of VNAT, Mr.Ngo Hoai Chung with the attendances of Khanh Hoa Department of Tourism, Vietnamese travel agents, Viet Nam Television and Vietnamese artists.
The first roadshow held in Tianjin City on 22 August attracted about 500 delegates including representatives of Tianjin Municipal Tourism Bureau, the Minister Counselor of the Vietnamese Embassy in China, representatives of Chinese tourism enterprises and media agencies.

On 24 and 26 August, VNAT organized two roadshows in Guiyang and Guangzhou cities which had 150 participants from local tourism enterprises and media agencies.
At the events, Guiyang Municipal Tourism Bureau and Guangzhou Tourism Association warmly welcomed the Vietnamese delegations and appreciated Viet Nam’s tourism promotion activities in China.

VNAT is expected to hold the second tourism promotion campaign in China in November.

Director General Nguyen Van Tuan meets Head of Taipei Economic and Cultural Office in Ha Noi
Update: Views:
(TITC) – On 4 May 2016, Director General of Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT), Mr.Nguyen Van Tuan had a meeting with Head of Taipei Economic and Cultural Office in Ha Noi, Mr.Shi Rui Qi.
Highly valueing good relationship between Viet Nam and Taiwan, Mr.Shi Rui Qi indicated that two sides has effectively implemented many cooperation activities in tourism field in terms of investment, promotion, human resource training, information exchange and product development.
Mr. Shi Rui Qi informed that the number of Vietnamese tourists to Taiwan grew by 70 percent since Taiwan piloted preferential visa policy for high-end tour groups from Asian emerging markets, including Viet Nam (from 1 Nov 2015). He also proposed Viet Nam to consider visa facilitation by applying e-visa or visa on arrival to increase Taiwanese tourist arrivals to Viet Nam.

For fostering tourists exchange between Viet Nam and Taiwan, the two sides should continue to cooperate in expanding air connections between Viet Nam and Taiwan as well as improving air services; organizing tourism promotion activities; raising liability of international tour operators in managing their clients abroad.
In the coming time, Viet Nam will develop quality tourism products in conformity with the taste and demand of Taiwanese tourists at destinations.
VNAT works with Tianjin Municipal Tourism Bureau (China)
Update: Tuesday, April 12, 2016
Views:
(TITC) – On 11 April 2016, in Ha Noi, Director General of Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT), Mr.Nguyen Van Tuan had a meeting with the delegation of Tianjin Municipal Tourism Bureau (China) led by Director General Yang Shi Hao.
Tianjin is one of the most developed cities in the North of China with approximately 15 million inhabitants and GDP per capita reaching over USD 17,000.
Tianjin receives attention from visitors due to its culture of Northern China, in harmony with Western ancient architecture.
The city welcomed around 3.2 million international tourist arrivals and 171 million domestic trippers per year; and there were about 1 million Tianjinese citizens travelling abroad per year, of which Viet Nam received above 100,000 arrivals (accounting for one-third of the number of Tianjinese tourists to Southeast Asian destinations).
Mr. Yang Shi Hao informed that Tianjinese in particular and Chinese in general love sea and leisure tourism in Viet Nam, particularly Nha Trang and Da Nang.
Especially, since charter flights from Tianjin to Nha Trang was launched in September 2015, the number of Chinese tourists to Nha Trang has been increasing significantly.
In 2015, there were about 40,000 Tianjinese passengers to Viet Nam by charter flights.
Besides, Tianjin has also become a transit hub for tourists from Beijing, Guangzhou to Viet Nam by charter flights.
Director General Nguyen Van Tuan suggested that beside Nha Trang and Da Nang, Viet Nam has many fascinate destinations namely Ha Long Bay, Son Doong Cave, Phu Quoc Island.
Furthermore, the accommodations in Viet Nam of high quality could meet increasing demand of tourists.
Viet Nam welcomed nearly 8 million international arrivals in 2015, of which the number of the Chinese reached 1.8 million arrivals; and around 2.5 million international tourists in the first 3 months of 2016, including more than 580,000 Chinese arrivals.
Director General Nguyen Van Tuan also supposed that Viet Nam would become a potential source market of Tianjin thanks to its population of over 90 million and the increasing number of high income travellers.
Hence, Tianjin should further promotion efforts to attract Vietnameses.
He emphasized that the two sides should utilize the tourism potentials and advantages to further strengthen tourism cooperation.
In the coming time, the two sides should focus on some issues as: facilitating tourists travelling; boosting tourism promotion through roadshows, travel marts; host famtrips, presstrips…
By the end of this year, VNAT planned to organize a famtrip for leading tourism enterprises and media in Tianjin to Phu Quoc Island with the aim of promoting Phu Quoc as well as Viet Nam’s image to Tianjinese citizens and all Chineses.
Viet Nam, Russia boost tourism cooperation
Update: Saturday, April 16, 2016
Views:
(TITC) - On 15 April, in Ha Noi, conference on tourism development cooperation between Viet Nam – Russia was jointly organized by Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT), Russian Federal Agency for Tourism (FAT) and Viet Nam Tourism Association (VITA).
Speaking at the conference, Director General of VNAT, Mr.Nguyen Van Tuan spoke highly of close cooperation relationship between Viet Nam and Russia for years, particularly in tourism cooperation.
In the 2011-2015 period, the number of Russian tourists to Viet Nam recorded year-on-year growth of 35.6 percent, from over 100,000 arrivals to nearly 340,000 arrivals.
In the first quarter of 2016, Viet Nam received about 110,000 Russian arrivals, up 13 percent over the same period last year.
Russia has become one of top 7 international source markets of Viet Nam.
Recently, tourism infrastructure and facilities in Viet Nam have been improved to meet the increasing demand of tourists.
Accommodation system has been developed in both quality and quantity.
The number of qualified foreign language-speaking tour guides, including Russian-speaking tour guides has increased significantly.
Furthermore, Viet Nam tourism sector is focusing on promoting 4 product types of sea, island tourism, culture tourism, nature tourism, and city tourism.
According to Deputy Head of Russian Federal Agency for Tourism Sergei Korneev, the number of Russians travelling abroad saw a remarkable decrease (-40%) from the end of 2014 to 2015 due to economic difficulties, however, it has rapidly rebounded from the beginning of 2016.
In addition, Russian tourists tend to seek new suitable destinations.
Mr. Sergey Korneev said Viet Nam is known as a safe, attractive destination with tourism products matching with Russian tourists’ taste.
Viet Nam should continue to boost promotion, create proper tourism products with competitive prices, invest in large-scale hotels and full-package services and cooperate with tourism enterprises in Russia in order to attract Russian tourists.
He informed that a representative office of the FAT in Southeast Asia named “Visit Russia” is officially opened in Viet Nam on 14 April (at 49 Hai Ba Trung Street, Ha Noi City).
This is the eighth representative office of the FAT in the world, aiming to introduce Russian tourism products to tourists in Viet Nam and the region.
At the conference, Vice Chaiman of VITA, Mr.Vu The Binh announced that VITA has signed with Phu Yen, Binh Dinh provinces and tourism enterprises to launch some promotional programs for Russian tourists. Besides, VITA will support the FAT to hold promotion activities in Viet Nam; collaborate with Visit Russia to popularize Russian tourism to Vietnamese citizens.
VITA also plans to establish Viet Nam – Russia outbound Club which will gather travel agencies in Viet Nam sending tourists to Russia.
He proposed Russia to simplify the entry-exit procedures to facilitate travelling for Vietnameses.
All delegates highlighted the need of strengthening tourism cooperation between Viet Nam and Russia. The both sides should consider to facilitate travelling, simplify entry-exit procedures while raising responsibility of tourism enterprises in managing tourists abroad; create price-competitive tours; diversify tourism products; ensure security and safety of destinations; popularize tourism information; and host famtrips, presstrips...
Award Ceremony of ASEAN Green Hotel and ASEAN Homestay
Update:
Views: 641
(TITC) - In the framework of conference on building Viet Nam tourism’s brand development strategy until 2025, vision to 2030, on April 16th, 2016, Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) held a ceremony to award ASEAN Green Hotel and ASEAN Homestay.
ASEAN Green Hotel standard was built by ASEAN member states since 2006 and announced in Thailand in 2008 and Brunei in 2012.
Each ASEAN member state may nominate up to ten hotels to honor this ASEAN Green Hotel Award every year.
ASEAN Homestay standard was built by ASEAN member states since 2011 and announced in 2012.
There are five ASEAN homestay groups awarded every year, including five homestays of each member state for one group.
10 hotels receiving ASEAN Green Hotel Award include: Ben Thanh – Rex, Chains Caravelle, Cuu Long – Majestic, Dong Khoi – Grand;
 Intercontinental Hanoi Westlake, Six Senses Ninh Van Bay, Sheraton Saigon, Equatorial Ho Chi Minh City, Sunrise Nha Trang and Hoang Anh Dat Xanh Dalat Resort.
This is the first year Viet Nam has 3 ASEAN Homestays awarded including Homestay groups awarded in Bac Ha District, Lao Cai Province; 
community based-tourism site in Lac Hamlet, Mai Chau District, Hoa Binh Province and An Bang Seaside Village Homestay, Hoi An City, Quang Nam Province.
For his part, Deputy General Director of VNAT Ha Van Sieu emphasized the value of green - an important factor of sustainable development and a value to build tourism brand.
He highly appriciated the contributions, innovations, experiences and environmental friendly solutions of tourist accommodations which were awarded. He hoped that the award will inspire a new movement for accomodation owners in Viet Nam to improve their standard and competitiveness capacity.

Update: Friday
Views:
(TITC) – In the framework of VITM Hanoi 2016, Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) coordinated with Viet Nam Tourism Association to hold International workshop on “E-marketing in tourism promotion and E-commerce in tourism business”.

According to tourism experts, Viet Nam is one of the safest destinations in the region and has great potential for tourism development.

Project on Viet Nam tourism’s brand development strategy
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On Jan 29th, 2016, Tourism Marketing Department (Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism) reported project on Viet Nam tourism’s brand development strategy to 2025, vision 2030.
The project was built on the basis of assessing situation of Viet Nam tourism’s brand and researching the world’s tourism brand development models.
In addition, the project also specified opinions, goals and solutions of Strategy and Master plan on Viet Nam tourism development to 2020, vision 2030 in regards of tourism brand development, which accorded with Viet Nam’s development tendencies.
The project identified tourism development in view of supply and demand sides, which focuses on enhancing competitive capacity.
The project will retain Viet Nam tourism brand identity set and slogan “Vietnam – Timeless Charm”; prioritize to promote 4 fundamental values of Viet Nam tourism (time, commitment, mystery and intensity) and 4 tourist product lines: cultural tourism, marine and island tourism, eco and natural tourism, city tourism).
To develop Viet Nam tourism’s brand, the project drafts out specific goals including: raising awareness and skills; focusing on developing remarkable destinations and tourist areas; identifying and promoting typical brands and images.
About solutions, the project prioritizes tourism promotion along with synchronous and long-term solutions such as: propagandizing and raising people’s awareness; mechanisms, policies and investments for tourism; supporting localities and tourism businesses; enhancing management capacity; strengthening inter-region and interdisciplinary linkages; international cooperation.
In addition, the project also sets up framework of action plans for each stage.
Speaking at the working session, Director General Nguyen Van Tuan highly appreciated result of the project.
He emphasized Viet Nam tourism’s brand development strategy should focus on prioritized solutions such as brand communication; building tourists confidence in Viet Nam tourism; attracting investors.
He also encouraged the engagement of tourism businesses, localities, and relevant sectors to develop Viet Nam tourism.
Round table meeting on coordination of international donors for Viet Nam tourism
Update:
Views:
(TITC) – On Jan, 28th 2016, the Viet Nam National Administration of Tourism (VNAT) with the technical support of EU- ESRT Project held a round table meeting on coordination of international donors for Viet Nam tourism.
According to VNAT’s International Cooperation Department, in the last five years, Viet Nam tourism has gained many remarkable achievements and recorded 7.94 million int’l arrivals and 57 million domestic trippers in 2015.
In the period 2011-2015, the average growth of int’l arrivals and domestic trippers were 5.7%/year and 16.3 %/year, respectively.
Total tourism receipts in 2015 reached VND 337.8 thousand billions contributing 5% of GDP, the average growth over 25%/year.
The above results have exceeded targets set for 2015 in the Viet Nam tourism’s development strategy to 2020, vision 2030.
However, 18,800 tourist accommodations with 355,000 rooms and tourism human resource of 1.78 million employees (including 555,000 tourism direct employees) have not reached the targets of the strategy for 2015.

to build legal documents and tourism planning; to develop tourist products; to support tourism promotion and human resource training…
Many foreign investment projects have played an important role in supporting Viet Nam tourism development towards sustainability, and high quality, high competitive capacity, contributing to poverty alleviation.
In the coming time, Viet Nam tourism sector expects to receive more int’l supports including:
enhancing institutional capacity and state management in tourism area focusing on revised tourism law, tourism integration in ASEAN and the world, and raising capacity of the tourism sector to cope with crisis, climate change, impacts of the world economy;
developing tourist products which focuses on special tourism products of high competitive advantage, and responsible tourism development;
constructing tourist infrastructure which focuses on building public tourist works and attracting major investors;
developing tourism human resource which focuses on training foreign languages and e-marketing for tourism managers;

improving competitive capacity of tourism enterprises.

Ao Châu Pond Rammer
Ao Chau pond rammer, in Ha Hoa district, is a tourist place named as terrestrial “Halong Bay”.
Along the 2nd national road, Ao Chau pond rammer is 140 km from Hanoi and 50 km from Viet Tri city, it belongs to area of three communes Am Thuong, Am Ha, Y Son, in Ha Hoa district, Phu Tho province.
Total area of this pond rammer is about 300 hectares, including nearly one hundred diverse islands.
Each of them has its own beauty which is deserved to discover.
According to legendary, on the voyage to settle kingdom of Hung King, he stopped at Ao Chau pond rammer, because terrain of Ao Chau is harmonious, and beautiful.
Water of Ao Chau pond rammer is extremely clean.
It is interesting when contemplating Ao Chau’s water in other moments in a day.
Visiting Ao Chau means staying away from the city, its atmosphere is perfect for relaxation and unwinding your mind.
The pond offers an amazing natural landscape with a combination of mountains, trees, birds, flowers.
In 2001, Government of Phu Tho province approved the detail planning of Ao Chau pond rammer resort with the total area of 1.500 hectares.
A feasible project was planned - Ao Chau eco-tourist website including activities such as: resort, rowing, fishing, mountain hiking.
Currently, Ao Chau pond rammer is an extremely attractive eco-tourism place for domestic and foreign tourists.

“Heritage” on Lang Chuong paddy field
Barringtonia acutangula heritage.
PTO- Recognized as a heritage plant in early 2013, the Barringtonia acutangula in Chuong Xa Commune, Cam Khe District is a pride of local people because of its cultural and historical values related to Hung Kings reign.
This heritage is located on a 500-square-meter island as known as Go Tho Temple.
The Barringtonia population consists of 91 large and imposing trees with exuberant green branches and leaves, their roots gather closely as a circle and their trunks grow towards many directions.
From a far distance, the cluster of the trees looks like a turtle swimming on the water. However, from two hills which are called as Elephant Hill and Ant Hill by the Chuong Xa people, it looks like a round dish of sticky rice.
Barringtonia flowers in two seasons i.e. May – June and August – September.
On the flowering seasons, Barringtonia burst in red, and become prominent amidst the green of the field.
The flowers bloom from the afternoon to night.
In tomorrow morning, the flowers fell down, covering the ground, floating on the water like a brilliant red carpet.
In the heritage population of Barringtonia, there is an ancient tomb of Tien Dung Princess - Lady Duong Thi Que.
The tomb is noted to be built in October 1061.
Throughout generations, the local people in the village tell an emotional story about this sacred ancient tomb.
Mr.Ngan, a village elder said: "My family has had many years to look after this temple.
When I was young, I was told by my grandparents that: In Chuong Xa, King Hung first came to Tam Thanh mound and later to Dinh Thuong and stationed his troops here.
In the water season, Tien Dung Princess often went sightseeing on pleasure – boat.
Later, when the princess died, the people built a high altar to worship her.
Go Tho Temple, Thuong Temple, and Hoi Dong Temple belong to the historical vestiges of Chuong Xa commune - where the monuments of the Hung King were once saved. The position of the communal house and temples in three places form a triangle, which is said to be like a tripod - a solid stand, symbolizing the strength and durability of the land bearing strong historical values.
Chuong Xa people, who have a long tradition of culture and a devoted admiration for the sacred historical values. This tradition has been increasingly promoted by the local people for thousands of years.
Therefore, the heritage population of Barringtonia and Tien Dung Princess Temple is considered by the people here as a treasure. The people have always tried their best to protect, maintain, sincerely worship and hand down to future generations.

Phu Tho: Reaching over 16/17 socio-economic targets in 2017
In 2017, gross regional domestic product (GRDP) is estimated at over VND 35.6 trillion, up 7.75% compared to 2016 year, and GRDP per person is estimated at VND 35.1 million.
The economic structure continues to make positive changes in the direction of increasing the proportion of industry-construction and services, decreasing in the agriculture, forestry and fishery sector, including 39% of industry-construction, 39% of services and 22% of agriculture, forestry and fisheries.
The national target program on new rural construction will continue to be directed, mobilized and integrated with many sources, improving the targets of new rural communes.
The rate of solidification of rural roads reached 60.2%, improvement works of irrigation, culture and health.
In 2017, 14-16 new rural communes will be recognized.
In 2017, total state budget revenue in the province is estimated at VND 5,443 trillion, equaling 111% of the plan.
The public service delivery agencies focus on the financial autonomy and self-responsibility in the 2017 – 2020 period.
Social security is guaranteed; cultural, educational and medical care continues to develop.
The rate of poor households is 8.81%, decreasing by 1.7% compared to 2016, the quality of education continues to be maintained, 648 national standard schools, increasing 36 schools compared to 2016, the rate of households participating in Health insurance reached 86%; 60% of communes, wards and towns achieved standard of health, 95% of rural population use safe water.
Particularly, in December 2017, UNESCO officially moved Phu Tho's Xoan Singing from the List of Intangible Cultural Heritage in Need of Urgent Safeguarding to the Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.
In order to implement socio-economic development tasks in 2018, Phu Tho Province will continue to develop industry and services as a force for economic growth, promote business development, drastically improve the investment environment and link between the breakthroughs, maintain political stability, social order and safety, ensure national defense and security, protect the environment and improve the people's life.
By 2018, the provincial economic growth rate (GRDP) will have been 7.5% or higher, of which: industry - construction will have increased by 9.8%; services will have increased by 7.0%; agriculture will have increased 3.0%.
GRDP per person will have reachd VND 38.6 million, export value will have reached USD 1.3 billion.
Total budget revenue in the area increased by 10.6% compared to 2017.
In 2018, strengthening the social security, strive to reduce the rate of poor households by 1.5%, the number of communes, wards and towns’s national health standards will have achieved 73.6%, the population participating in health insurance will have reached 87.3%.

Hon cake - a local specialities
PTO- Hon cake (or rounded cake), a traditional cake of the communes of Kim Duc, Phuong Lau, and Hung Lo in Viet Tri city, Phu Tho province.
So far, Phu Tho is famous for palm forest, tea hills, Tai cake (ear cake), but Hon cake - a kind of folk cake from Hung Vuong's era.
In Phu Tho province, especially countryside markets in communes of Hung Lo, and Kim Duc, it's not difficult to see a Hon cake peddler.
This cake is milky white, slightly yellow, suitable for a breakfast meal.
Hon cake in An Thai village, Phuong Lau commune is made from rice which is ground into the dough, then sieved to smooth.
The cook burned leaves and fruits to ashes then soaking in the water for 5 to 7 days and filtering it to boil with dough to becomes a bit condensed.
After that, he knead when it's hot with pork stuffing and put them in the steamer.
The best way to savor Hon cake is to eat it right away when it is still warm with fish sauce, chili and pepper to feel the typical taste of Phu Tho's forest.
People is buying Ms.Hong's Hon cake at Hung Lo market, Viet Tri city.
Long time ago, this cake was called koel cake because of its two sharp heads; and usually made on Tet holidays to offer Hung King and some other events.
Nowadays, the cake is rounded, and local people call it "Hon" cake, which is a typical traditional dish of the midland mountainous village.
Presevation of Vi folk singing
Artist Ha Thi Song is teaching Vi folk singing of Muong ethnic, so as to express her hope that the next generations will preserve this unique culture of Muong ethnic.
PTO- As a duet with traditional melody, reflecting the life, and the love of peole, Vi folk singing is the indispensable spiritual thing of the Muong ethnic, bearing traditional cultural identity, is preserved and promoted.
Nobody knows exactly when this folk singing originated, people just know this kind of folk singing was handed down to young generations by Muong’s elders in the village.
On the occasion of festivals, this singing can take place throughout the event for greetings, affection expression and appointments.
Vi folk singing appears not only in festivals or events but also in the daily life.
This is kind of singing in a couple (boy and girl).
Its lyrics are like the confession of love.
Many couple have been married thanks to this gentle and touching melody.
However, to express the soul of Vi folk singing, the singer have to be expert in literature, poetry as well as smart to be able to apply the daily knowledge into the lyrics reasonably, and gently.
Festival is a chance for Muong people to perform Vi folk singing - a special cultural feature of the ethnic.
Although wrinkles on Artist Ha Thi Song’s face show the marks of ageing, her enthusiasm for the traditional Vi folk singing has never ever faded.
On the weekend, she often sings for children and grandchildren in the village.
She has also recorded the lyrics in a notebook with the desire to preserve the beauty of Muong ethnic culture for later generations.
Mr. Vu Tien Bac, Vice Chairman of Tan Son District People's Committee said: Recently, in order to protect and promote Vi folk singing, the commune has managed classes for artisans to teach the younger generation in the residential areas, simultaneously establishing Vi singing clubs.
In addition, the district leadership has instructed the Culture and Education Department to plan to bring Vi folk singing into the curriculum, and expand to the whole the district.
In fact, Vi folk singing in particular and Muong folk songs in general have quietly existed for a long time with many high educational meanings.
Therefore, it is a priceless cultural value that can not be faded.
Because modern life is challenging the culture of ethnic groups, the attendance of the whole political system is necessary in preserving Vi folk singing.
Ha Hoa district preserves and promotes cultural values
Worship of the Mother Au Co at Au Co temple in Hien Luong commune is the first the national intangible cultural heritage of Ha Hoa district.
PTO- Ha Hoa is a region of culture and history which is associated with the Hung King era. Ha Hoa has a diversified system of tangible and intangible heritage.
Therefore, for many years, Ha Hoa district has always paid much attention to preserving and promoting the values ​​of cultural heritage.
There are 85 monuments in Ha Hoa district, 9 monuments of which ranked at the national level, and 13 at provincial level.
In particular, these tangible cultural heritages contain unique artistic architecture and aesthetic value.
The Mother Au Co temple is the most famous destination of spiritual tourism associated with Au Co and Lac Long Quan legend in Hien Luong commune. It is ranked as a national historical-cultural relics by the Ministry of Culture and Information.
Local people also hold the Mother Au Co temple Festival on 7th of Lunar January every year.
Along with the worshipping ceremony, there are many sports activities and interesting folk games, attracting thousands of visitors.
Besides, Ha Hoa district is a home of many relics such as the Dong communal house, Nghe temple in Van Lang commune worshiping two talented generals Le Thi A Lan and Le Anh Tuan, Chu Hung temple in Am Ha commune, White temple in Hau Bong commune, Thuong temple in Thuong commune, etc.
Ha Hoa district is also the location of well-known war zones in the resistance war against the French colonialists such as Van-Hien Luong war zone in Hien Luong Commune, 10 war zone in the communes of Dai Pham, Ha Luong, Gia Dien, Am Ha, etc.
The district is also known by the famous tourist destinations of Ao Gioi - Suoi Tien, and Ao Chau lagoon.
These sites have been planned, invested upgraded its facilities, and enhanced the diversification of tourism products.
In order to preserve and promote cultural heritage values, the district has well implemented the propaganda and mobilization of the preservation of various kinds of heritages in the localities, conducting the restoration that's not impact to its values.

Creating a safe and stable investment environment
PTO- Phu Tho province is gradually developing a modern industry, focusing on attracting high-tech corporations and enterprises to invest in industrial parks and clusters.
The current challenge is how to manage and supervise these objects in order to both meet the demand of socio-economic development and maintain political security and social order and safety in the workplace as well as resident area.
There are about 400 foreign laborers working in the province, mainly in industrial zones.
Over the past time, the management of foreign workers has been well implemented by the provincial authorities, contributing to ensuring security and order in the industrial zones, creating a safe and stable investment environment for foreigners in Phu Tho province.
As a 100% South Korean-owned enterprise specializing in garments, Kee Eun Vietnam Co., Ltd in Thuy Van Industrial Zone has created jobs for about 2,000 workers.
The company has well implemented the registration for foreign laborers at the management board of the industrial zones. Foreign workers has well abided by the provisions of Vietnam law on entry, exit and labor.
Mr.Kim Han Yong, General Director of Kee Eun Vietnam Co., Ltd.said there are more than 10 foreign workers from Korea, China and Philippines working at the positions of production management, quality management, sewing machine management in the company.
The company has also disseminated the laws and regulations on state management as well as local customs and habits for these workers to ensure order and security situation.
At present, a majority of foreign laborers in industrial zones and clusters is Korean. The rest is Chinese, Malaysian and Filipino. Most of them work in positions of management and experts.
On August 29th, 2017, the Chairman of the provincial People's Committee signed the document No.3782UBND-KGVX on enhancing the management of foreign laborers working in the province.
In details, the Department of Labor, Invalids and Social Affairs coordinates with relevant agencies and units in guiding agencies and enterprises that employ foreign laborers to strictly observe provisions of Vietnam laws in the foreign labor in Vietnam.
Mr.Duong Quoc Lam, Deputy Head of the provincial management board of industrial zones said that management board of the provincial industrial zones regularly coordinates with the Department of Labor, Invalids and Social Affairs and the provincial police agency to manage the entry, exit, transit and residence of the foreign workers in the province, at the same time, disseminating, inspecting and requesting enterprises employing foreign laborers to strictly observe the Vietnam law and promptly handle violation cases.
People's Committees of districts, towns and cities have directed the functional agencies to review the number of foreign employees working and living in the area under their respective management.
Enterprises, organizations, individuals, contractors employing foreign laborers in the province must strictly perform the registration.
At present, some enterprises in the industrial zones tend to recruit foreign workers to management positions to ensure expertise and operational technique.
Therefore, provincial authorities need to strengthen the management of foreign workers in the province, especially those working in industrial zones and clusters to ensure the order and security in the area as well as safe of foreign workers, creating a safe and stable investment environment.

Gioi Pond – Tien (Fairy) Stream in Ha Hoa district
Gioi (God) Pond – Tien (Fairy) Stream, located at Na Mountain, Quan Khe commune, Ha Hoa district, Phu Tho province, is 80km from Viet Tri city and 15km from Ao Chau.
Tien stream crosses over rock slits, forming a white flow standing out on the green background of mountains, and blending with blue color of the sky to make a spectacular mysterious scene.
According to the legedary, once upon a time, there was only the Fairy Well where fairies bathed.
Then, water in the well was risen forming waterfalls, some of them were 20m in height.
When Jade Emperor raised the level of water to create waterfalls, water poured itself into valley forming ponds.
Therefore, Tien Stream seems more attractive to tourists when they visit Phu Tho province.
Hung King museum
On January 1st 2008, Phu Tho Museum was officially built, with a total area of 15.732m2.
The museum was designed with three floors, replicating a “house on stilt” in the north of Vietnam, four sloping red-tile roofs based on Dong Son architecture in combination with modern architecture.
On April 14th 2010 (March 1st 2010 in lunar calendar), the museum was inaugurated.
There are nearly 11000 relics in the museum, presenting for thousands years of Phu Tho history.
The first part exhibits relics about People in Phu Tho in general, Vietnam in particular from Hung Kings dynasties to the Feudal dynasties; 
the history of fights against foreign aggression, and the renovation of Phu Tho from 1986 up to now.
The second part shows objects based on the subjects related to political requirements.
The third part is an outside exhibit of large-sized objects such as: tanks, warships, aircraft; and ethological, archaeological and revolutional historic subjects.
Apart from Hung King Temple, Hung King museum is an attractive destination for tourists when they visit Phu Tho province.

On the morning of 14th March 2016, at the Melia Hotel in Hanoi, Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI) in coordination with the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) held the announcement ceremony of Provincial Competitiveness Index (PCI) in 2016.

Deputy Permanent Secretary of the Provincial Party Committee Bui Van Quang attended the ceremony to announce the PCI.
2016 is the 12th year, the PCI report has been conducted based on feedback from more than 11,600 enterprises, including over 10,000 private enterprises in 63 provinces and cities and nearly 1,600 FDI enterprises in 14 provinces and cities.
The PCI aims to assess the business environment, the quality of economic governance, and the administrative reform efforts of local governments in order to promote the development of private enterprises.
According to reports, the quality of economic governance of provinces and cities continued to improve in a positive direction.

For FDI enterprises, there are similar positive signs when 11% of enterprises have increased their investment capital and 63% of enterprises have recruited more workers.

PhuTho ranked at the 29th with 58.60 points, rising 6 grades compared to 2015.
Lai Chau and Cao Bang are the last two provinces in the ranking list.

Lam Thao Fertilizers and Chemicals Joint Stock Company
Commences construction of NPK production line no.4 with capacity of 150,000 tons/year
Representatives of the company leadership, construction consultants, contractors, and insurance company conducted the groundbreaking ceremony.
In the series of activities celebrating the 55th anniversary of its official operation day (24th June 1962 – 24th June 2017), on 22nd February 2017, Lam Thao Fertilizers and Chemicals JSC commenced construction of NPK production line no.4 with a capacity of 150,000 tons/year.

The production line apply advanced production technologies for mixing materials with a combination of spraying molten urea and pelletizing with high automation features; pollution sources relating to dust, air, noise and waste water are treated thoroughly, ensuring industrial safety and ecological environment in the factory’s premises and the surrounding areas.
With two main products i.e. medium content NPK fertilizer and high content NPK fertilizer (the total nutrition of 39-51%), the construction investment of NPK production line no.4 with its capacity of 150,000 tons/year not only contributes to production expansion by increasing its entire NPK production capacity from 750,000 tons/year to 900,000 tons/year as but also plays an important role in diversifying products and enabling the company to domain the market segment of high content NPK.
