High-tech fresh chicken egg production factory launched by DTK Joint Stock Company
On 25th February, in Hanoi, DTK Joint Stock Company(DTK Company) held a press conference to launch the project of DTK PhuTho high-tech fresh chicken egg production plant in Te Le commune, Tam Nong district invested by DTK Joint Stock Company.
This is a world leading fresh chicken egg production plant applying the most advanced scientific technologies of Japan, America and Israel to provide good, fresh and nutritious high – quality chicken eggs for consumers.
The plant which is constructed in the area of 42 ha with the total investment capital of above 800 billion dong, is expected to have a capacity of 175 million eggs/year.
The entire production process of DTK Phu Tho fresh chicken egg production plant is completely automatic, closed, controlled and isolated from the external environment, which ensures absolute bio-security, food safety and hygiene.
This is the first time when a 100% Vietnam owned company has invested in a world-leading green technology system and closed processes from producing input food materials, caring chicks and commercial chickens, environmental treatment to collecting, processing and packaging of finished eggs on a large scale with a traceability of each production stage.
It takes only 24 hours for chicken eggs to reach the stores and supermarkets.
In addition, chicken manure discharged by DTK Phu Tho fresh chicken egg production plant is processed through the microbial fermentation method with technology lines imported from CHUBU ECOTEC (Japan) to protect environment and produce fresh organic fertilizer products with a capacity of 7,000 tons/year.
This is a completely new technology first introduced in Vietnam.
According to the investor's announcement, this project will be officially inaugurated on 4th March, 2017.
Stream crab – the unique food of ethnic people in Xuan Son
Xuan Son national park (Xuan Son commune, Tan Son district) is well known for its jungle ecosystem on limestone mountains where a wide range of categories of flora and fauna exist.
Characteristics of moutainous area formed interesting cultures, including cuisine culture. Stream crabs – a distinguished food of ethnic people impressed tourists.
Stream crabs, as known as stone crabs, live in stone mountain slits.
In summer, from twilight to the end of the night, they move from stone slits to streams.
That is the perfect time for catching them.
During daylight, the crabs stay in their holes in stone slits, to catch them, we have to use rod and worm baits to lure them and drag them out.
This is such a simple way that local kids can catch the crabs.
The crabs are cooked in a homely manner with only a few spices.
Stream crabs are normally about 7 to 10 crabs per kilogram.
At the bottom of the pot is a layer of fresh citronella, crabs are neatly placed and boiled on firewood stove in 15 minutes with small fire.
Color of boiled crabs turn into pinkish yellow and dark brown, with a special scent of crabs with limegrass.
The crabs are eaten with salt mixed with chilli, taste of is amazing.
In the summer, tourists visit Xuan Son national park is crowded, thus, it is lucky when having a chance to try the stream crabs (as they are only occasionally available when local people catch them). The tourists are definitely impressed so that they praise the food with taste of jungle.
Hung King Temple
Hung King temple, located on Nghia Linh mountain, Hy Cuong commune, Viet Tri city, Phu Tho province, is 85km away from Hanoi.
Hung King temple includes Lower Temple, Middle Temple, Upper Temple, Well Temple, and Thien Quang Pagoda.
There are 225 steps from Dai Mon Gate to Lower Temple, which was built in the 15th century.
The Hung King Temple Festival is annually organized from 8th to the 11th days of the third lunar month.
Since 2001, the 10th day of the third lunar March has become a national holiday.
The Hung King Temple Festival is one of the most important and sacred festivals toward Vietnamese people, which offers an opportunity for Vietnamese to visit the land of origin.
The Hung Temple festival has a special position in the minds of the Vietnamese people.
On December 6th 2012, in Paris (France), UNESCO officially recognized the worship of Hung Kings in Phu Tho Province as Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.
Every year, millions of people visit Hung King temple to commemorate their ancestors and pray for good weather, abundant harvests, good luck and good health.
Thuong Dang Than (Superior Saints) Temple in the village of “bouncers”
In Van Luong Commune (Tam Nong District) which is well known as its “boasting” custom, people should be deeply impressed by the complex of ancient temples and banyan trees.
Thuong Dang Than (Superior Saints) Temple worships the three great generals who served the 18th Hung King (Hung Due Vuong) in protecting the country in Hung – Thuc civil war. Their names are First Loyal Highest Tan Vien Son, the Second Loyal Highest Cao Son, and the Third Loyal Highest Trung Son.
According to the legend, in the reign of Hung Due Huong, the King had a talented and virtuous son-in-law named Mountain God Tan Vien, who helped to maintain our peace and prosperity of the country.
At that time, in his incognito working trip throughout the country, Mountain God Tan Vien collected three brave and loyal generals, who were Cao Son – Quy Minh brothers and a young man named Son.
The three generals supports to Mountain God Tan Vien in protecting the national borders from invasion of the Thuc empire.
To commemorate the merits of Mountain God Tan Vien and his generals, Hung King granted a favor to Thanh Uyen, Van Lang (currently is Van Luong Commune) that they eternally worship and restore the temple of the three Superior Saints.
Thuong Dang Than (Superior Saints) Temple is located at slope of Tron Hill and surrounded by ancient pond named as Bach Thuy Lien Tri.
Direction of the temple toward the south with total area of 780m2, architecture of the temple was designed as shape of Nhat (one) letter (based on Chinese characters).
Moreover, every year, in the spring, on the occasion of Moutain God Tan Vien’s birthday (the 15th of lunar January) and his victory (the 10th of lunar September), local people hold big festivals with palanquin processions and many other folk games.

Lang Cave in Xuan Son district
If visiting Xuan Son, the tourists should not miss Lang cave, an miracle cave.
Lang cave The entrance of the cave is in front of Muong Lang field.
Height of the cave is up to15 or 20 meters, and its width is nearly the same.
The cave extends along the limestone mountain.
There is a large stream flowing along the bottom of the cave.
At the points where the cave expands, its ground is covered with a layer of rocks, sand and clay.
On the roof of the cave, there are stalactites. For millions of years, they have been shaped into various beautiful and unique forms.
Area of Lang cave is large enough for thousands of tourists at the same time.
Inside the cave, there are many natural pillars.
creating a very amazing scene.
In the past time, on the 4th of the first lunar month, the villagers of Muong Lang play natural musical instruments within the cave.
Tho Than cave in Thanh Son district
Located in Thanh Son district, Tho Than cave is one of the biggest and longest cave in Xuan Son commune.
Tho Than cave expresses deeply into Ten mountain, the entrance of the cave is in front of Muong Lang field.
There are many stalactites, which is soft as which soil.
Therefore, people named it as the “Soil cave”.
Tho Than cave is a mystery because even local Dao and Muong ethnic people have not discovered all the cave.
From the bottom of the mountain to the mouth of cave, there are 300 steps.
When stepping inside, tourists would be surprised by miracle, mysterious beauty of the stalactites.
Every stalactite has its own magical history according to people’s imagination
After roads with full of obstacles, the tourists will be more interested in natural panorama.
The most special and impressive trait of Tho Than cave is “a fairy tale curtain” – created by the natural stalactites, and local people named it as Princess bed.
Gheo Singing in Phu Tho
This is the unique cultural and spiritual product of the two ethnic groups Viet – Muong only found in Phu Tho.
As a formal and polite form of address, old men and old women in ceremonial occasions are called, ‘quan trum’; ‘ba trum’; while young man and young woman are called “quan anh”, “quan chi”.
Both the nuoc nghia (twined villages) use such formal form of address regardless of hosts or guests.
The most beautiful ao the (a male traditional dress), white pants, and turbans for festivals are the costume of “quan anh”. Meanwhile, the costume of “quan chi” are five –panel traditional addresses, white blouses, silk oak pants, brassieres, colorful waistbands, key chains and kerchiefs.
How to sing: About Gheo Singing in general and Phu Tho Gheo Singing in particular, it is not too difficult to sing but it requires singers to sing legato to get the right tones.
So without practicing, it is difficult to keep the cadence. In Gheo Singing festivals, there are specific requirements for behavior, dressing, voice, procedure and location.
In Gheo Singing, the old men and women are called ‘quan trum’ and ‘ba trum’; while young men and women are called “quan anh”, “quan chi”. It is a formal and polite form of address.
Both the nuoc nghia (twined villages) use such formal form of address regardless of hosts or guests.
The ao the (a male traditional dress), white pants and turbans are the costume of “quan anh” while the costume of “quan chi” are five – panel traditional addresses, white blouses, silk oak pants, brassieres, colorful waistbands, key chains and kerchiefs.
The guests sitting on the bed in the middle of the house are often “quan trum”, “quan anh” while “ba trum”, “quan chi” often sit on the beds in the space aside.
Xoan singing of Phu Tho province
On December 24, 2011, at the 6th Meeting of the Inter-governmental Committee for the Conservation of Intangible Cultural Heritage of UNESCO held in Bali (Indonesia) Vietnam’s Xoan singing in Phu Tho was officially recognized by UNESCO as an Intangible Cultural Heritage in Need of Urgent Safeguarding.
Xoan singing (also called Lai Len singing, Dum singing, Tho singing, Cua Dinh singing) is a kind of performing art, attached to cult of worshipping Hung Kings.
Up to now, Xoan singing has become one of the original cultures in Phu Tho province.
Xoan singing has existed for more than 2000 years since Hung Kings dynasty’s national construction.
Four old Xoan guilds are An Thai, Phu Duc, Kim Doi and Thet located in two communes of Phuong Lau va Kim Duc (Viet Tri City, Phu Tho Province).
There are three forms of Xoan singing: worship singing for the Hùng kings and village guardian spirits; ritual singing for good crops, health and luck; and festival singing where villagers alternate male and female voices in a form of courtship.
Xoan singing is organized into Xoan guilds, each including 15-18 people, of which are 2-9 male instrumentalists called kep, and 6-12 female singers called dao.
Xoan singing of Phu Tho depends on the people’s knowledge, awareness and responsibilities to the community.
Xoan singing associated with Worship of Hung Kings is a significant factor in the spiritual life of ethnic minorities in Vietnam.

“Cap Sac” Ritual of Dao ethnic people in Phu Tho
« Cap Sac » (also known as « Lap Tinh »), the lunar name-giving ritual that every Dao male experiences, is an integral ritual of Dao ethnic people.
not only is it a distinguished ritual, but also it integrates cultural and religious quintessence, as well as a comprehensive value system concerning history, culture, education, and art.
Mainly inhabitating in the area of districts of Tan Son, Thanh Son, and Yen Lap, Dao people in Phu Tho ranks third to Kinh and Muong people in provincial population ratio. There are two main streams of them: the Dao Quan Chet (close-fitting-trousered) group (alternatively Dao Chit (close-fit) or Dao Nga Hoang), and Dao Deo Tien (coin-bearing) group (or just Dao Tien (coin)).
Each group has its own forms of belief-action, yet generally they all reflect same given values.
According to Dao’s custom, a man performed “Cap Sac” will be considered as a mature man, no matter how old he is. He, therefore, can take part in important business of the village, can give the sorcerer a hand, can make ceremonial offerings, and becomes the true off-spring of the Ban King.
The Cap Sac ritual is normally held at the end of the year.
It lasts 2-3 days with two main ceremonies namely Trinh Dien (presentation) and Thu Den (light-receiving).
Within a family, Cap Sac ritual goes in the order of generations: father to sons, older brothers to younger ones.
After Cap Sac, the receiver of the ritual will be given a religious name, lunar name, and a set of moral principles specifying 10 prohibited actions and 10 encouraged ones admonishing of moral philosophy, executing good deeds, avoiding bad and malicious ones, leading a responsible life towards one’s family and society, living in harmony with mother nature, conserving traditional customs and habits, etc..
Mention of Cap Sac reminds its special activities of Mua Chuong (Bell-dancing), Doi Den (Carrying lights on head), Pao Dung singing, etc.
Seeing a name-giving ritual is a great thing to all of one’s senses.
They can simultaneously enjoy reverberant melodious sounds of gongs, drums, bronze bells and folk songs, and admire vigorously colorful traditional costume of Dao Quan Chet people, lissome bee wax traits of Dao Tien ones, plastic arts manifested in paper-cutting pictures, and worshipping paintings through which both local daily life and spiritual belief are vividly described.
The stable conservation of Dao people’s life in Phu Tho through thousands of years is the most persuasive evidence of Cap Sac’s value in functioning as a culture and belief action, a space for community life, a chance to educate youngsters of traditions and culture of the ethnic group.
It also plays as a multi-aspect picture genuinely reflecting their life, which, therefore, makes significant contributions to intangible cultural treasure of motherland Phu Tho and needs to be nurtured and preserved.
Du Yến temple festival
From February 10th to 11th (lunar January 14th to 15th), Du Yen temple festival, held in Chi Tien commune, Thanh Ba district, commemorate the virtues of Princess Ngoc Loan, who was also known as the Holy Mother of the Country as well as one of the talented female generals of Hai Ba Trung.
According to the legend, Princess Ngoc Loan, whose real name was Nguyen Thi Hanh (also called Hanh Nuong), was both intelligent and courageous with all the four moralities of an ideal woman: homemaking skills, appearance, speech manners, good behavior. She assisted Trung Queen to waive up the flag of justice, defeating the Chinese invaders.
Thanks to her excellence, she was inaugurated by Hai Ba Trung as “Head of the Vanguards”.
After defeating the enemy, Female General Hanh Nuong visited her hometown, opening a feast to her army on the 15th day of lunar January.
Since then, on the occasion of every 14th – 15th of (lunar) January, the villagers praying festivals to merit her gratitude, praying for good weather, good harvest, peace and happiness to everyone.
In the reign of Le Canh Hung King, she was honored as the Holy Mother of the Country and named in the list of national worship.
Du Yen Temple was recognized as a national historic monument in 1993.
Du Yen Temple Festival has some typical rituals such as collecting water from the river to the temple, palanquin processions to be held on the 14th of (lunar) January, offerings and sacrifices.
The legend says that on the birthday of the Holy Mother, fairy descended on the mulberry grove, singing and dancing like a festival. Therefore, on each scarifying anniversary of the Holy Mother, it requires a fairy dancing team including 04 girls from 11 to 13 years old to perform beautiful dances like fairies to serve the scarifying ritual and water procession. This dancing performance also creates a distinguished characteristic of Du Yen Temple Festival.
Au Co Foremother Festival
Au Co foremother temple is constructed in Hau Le dynasty, located in Hien Luong commune, Ha Hoa district, Phu Tho province.
Every year, not only local people, but also people over the country come to join in foremother Au Tho temple festival on 7th of Lunar January.
Beginning of the festival is the worshipping ceremony dedicated to the village’s genie in communal house, after that is ceremony at The Foremother Au Co ceremony.
They hold ceremony of thurification and offerings (including 100 kilos of cakes, 100 Pham Oan – steamed glutinous rice molded into a truncated cone, fruits and flowers).
During 3 consecutive days, the festival takes place from 7th to 9th of lunar January.
Many outside ethnic games such as fairy swing, human chess, cock fighting, the To Tom card, and the local and tourists can take part in.
History of Foremother Au Co temple
According to the legend, within 50 sons following foremother Au Co to mountains, her first son stopped at Phong Chau to found the Van Lang kingdom, mastering the country and start Hung Kings reign.
The 49 sons keep following the foremother to the source of Thao river – Hien Lương. Because of its sublime landscape, they stationed to teach local people about rice cultivation, silkworm rearing.
Since then, villages became prosperity.
When the people owned good skills, foremother Au Co and fairies flew to the sky, leaving a pink silk ribbon at the foot of a banyan tree.
Hien Luong’s peoples built a temple at the foot of the tree in honor of the mother’s merit called the Temple of Mother Au Co.
Existing of millions year history, Au Co mother temple has three times conferred a title by dynasties.
Firstly, in the dynasty of Le Thanh Thong (1428-1527), he sent his senior courtier to Ha Hoa to deify and embellish the temple.
Secondly, in the dynasty of Nguyen, Tu Duc king conferred the temple as National Foremother temple in 1874.
Thirdly, on August 3rd 1991, Ministry of Culture and Information awarded certification of national historical vestige to Foremother Au Co temple.
Nowadays, the Foremother Au Co Temple is a favorite place of tourist and an important worshiping temple in the land of Hung Kings - Phu Tho province.
Annually, the temple receives large number of pilgrims.
Steamed wild vegetables – the unique dish of Muong People
For generations, steamed wild vegetables has been a familiar food in daily meals of Muong people.
Due to their habits, Muong people tend to prefer vegetables that is sour, acrid, or bitter, which is why wild steamed vegetables is among their favorite dishes.
Steaming method retains the original taste and colors of vegetables.
The food normally made of various vegetables, including sweet potato buds, pumpkin buds, amaranths, mugworts, perillas, betal leaves, wild eggplants (the ones of the same size as normal eggplants but with thorns), wild banana flowers, etc., 
and indispensable components are papaya buds and leaves –and spotlessly white bunches of male papaya flowers (and sometimes « dang cay » leaves as well).
The integral ingredients function as ones that make the dish have a taste of bitterness.
About the receipt, the vegetables is washed, thinly sliced, well mixed, and steamed with a wooden steamer.
When the water boils, put vegetables into the steamer.
After 15-20 minutes, when scent of the vegetables, especially piper lolot leaf, can be smelled, the dish is done.
The vegetables is cooked by steamed, so it can not be overdone. The vegetables manages to stay in its original colors even after being cooked.
A standard steamed vegetable dish requires its original colors to be retained, for instance the white wild eggplants and male papaya flowers, and the light brown wild banana flowers.
Simultaneously, the specific acrid and bitter taste of mugworts and papaya leaves should be kept as well.
Steamed vegetables is an traditional dish of Muong People. They can easily make this dish after a hard-working day.
What makes the dish even more special is various medical herbs that Muong People include in it, which are bitter and acrid ones, preventing from cold and influenza, strengthening body immune systems, etc.
However, in order that the steamed vegetable to be even more charming, it should be accompanied by the fish-bowel-sauce.
Ingredients for the sauce are fish bowels, saffrons, chillies, tomatoes, onion sprouts and “fermented cold rice”.
They are all boiled to be thick.
It is stated by Mrs.Van that the key to a delicious sauce is the quality of the fish bowels: local Muong people choose carp bowels, get them well washed then seasoned with above mentioned spices.
One more noticeable thing is the oil that would be used in stir frying the bowels should derive from the very own fish.
Cooked fish-bowel-sauce is dark yellow because of the fresh saffron color and greasy taste of the fish bowels.
That is the moment when people gather around to enjoy the charming steamed vegetable dish.
The natural acridity and bitterness at the top of the tongue mixes with the greasiness, sweetness, spiciness and scent of the fish-bowel-sauce will leave an unforgettable impression for table companions.

There are 874 intangible cultural heritages and 308 relics in Phu Tho province
Implementing the Plan No.3089/KH-UBND of the Provincial People’s Committee on the inventory of cultural heritages in the whole province, and based on the Circular No.04/TT- BVHTTDL of the Culture, Sports and Tourism Ministry, the Provincial Department of Culture, Sports and Tourism has recently coordinated with the relevant departments and People’s Committees of districts, cities and towns in directing and guiding the local governments to inventory cultural heritages including both tangible and intangible cultural heritages in accordance with regulations.
The inventory results show that: In the area of ​​13 districts, towns and cities of the province, there are 874 intangible cultural heritages which now exist and are practiced in the community.
These heritages are classified into 7 categories including 6 heritages of spoken and written languages, 103 heritages of folk literatures, 48 heritages of folk performing arts, 59 heritages of social customs, 369 heritages of festivals, 24 heritages of traditional crafts, and 77 heritages of folk knowledge.
However, after inventory, 6 intangible cultural heritages were listed into intangible heritages in need urgent safeguarding.
Regarding the tangible cultural heritages, there are total of 967 monuments and ruins; including rated 308 monuments (1 special national monument, 73 national monuments and 234 provincial monuments).
Currently, the two typical intangible cultural heritages are Tro Tram Festival and Dao Xa Temple Festival which were recognized by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism and listed into national intangible cultural heritages.
Some other festivals are continuously having their scientific profiles developed and applied to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism for being listed as national intangible cultural heritages in 2017.

“Dam duong” custom of the Muong people in the ancestral land
“Dam duong” or “Cham duong” involves pounding rice activity but it is more artistic and well organized during the festivals of the Muong people.
In the Muong’s language, “duong” is a wooden mortar and “cham” means pounding.
“Dam duong” is often celebrated during the New Year, weddings, seasonal festivals or house building.
The mortar, made from a large trunk, has shape as a boat, while the pestle is as long as a yoke with a narrow waist for easily handling.
Dam duong is using pestle to pound rice a mortar, especially Dam duong is only performed by women.
At the beginning of the festival, the eldest female in the family stands ahead of the mortar to make the first pounding as beginning of the ceremony called the “mother pounding”.
Afterwards, daughters and granddaughters in the family begin to pound and these pounding are called “daughter pounding” or “granddaughter pounding”.
Each sound changes in harmony to the beat of the pestles. The sounds of pounding rice create a beautiful symphony in combination with simple but pretty dances.
Foreign non-governmental aids in PhuTho
Photo Caption: Leaders of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Samaritan'S Purse give presents to students of Van Lung Primary School, Phu Tho Town.
For around 10 years recently, there has been a silent source contributing to the socio-economic development of localities which is rarely mentioned – it is the source of aids from foreign non-governmental organizations.
With its role as both a management agency and an advocacy agency, in 2016, the Department of Foreign Affairs continued to effectively carry out the work related to foreign non-governmental organizations, contributing to the socio-economic development process of the province.
At present, there are 34 foreign non-governmental organizations and foreign individuals implementing 49 aid programs and projects in 13 districts, towns and cities, and in 7 departments and branches. The total value of pledged aid projects is over USD $ 4.2 million and the disbursement value in 2016 is USD $ 2.46 million.
The fields attracting aids from non-governmental organizations operating in Phu Tho are various and diverse, including: Agriculture; Health; Education, etc.
In the field of social protection: Foreign non-governmental organizations have paid great attention to the disabled, dioxin victims and orphaned children at the sponsoring centers.
Besides the projects focusing on each specific field, there are also programs and projects on capacity building for people such as the projects "Capacity Building and Outreach" conducted by AFAP – Australia in Tan Son District; "Enhancing the participation in socio-economic development and poverty reduction" funded by Plan Foundation, etc.
The programs and projects that have been implemented have promoted their values, meeting the set objectives and plans; focused on building and equipping facilities for schools and hospitals; supported disadvantaged women and children in poor districts ... making significant contributions to hunger eradication, poverty reduction and new rural development according to the province's policy.
Especially, from 2nd October to 9th October 2016, the Department of Foreign Affairs cooperated with Habitat for Humanity – United States, Tam Nong District People's Committee and related agencies to build the content and successfully implement the program "Vietnam Big Builds 2016". It is the program of building 22 houses with the participation of 210 volunteers from 13 countries and territories in the world – under the project "Improving housing for poor families in Xuan Quang Commune and Huong Nha Commune – Tam Nong District" sponsored by Habitat.
The volunteer welcome ceremony and the closing program saw the presence of Susan Suton, US Deputy Chief of Mission in Vietnam and Haike Manning, Ambassador of New Zealand in Vietnam.
In addition to work with foreign non-governmental organizations, the Department also expanded its relationships with Embassies of Japan, Korea, India ... to propose scholarship programs and sponsor projects for difficult areas, contributing to the socio-economic development of the province.
Xuan Son National park
Located in Tan Son district, PhuTho province, Xuan Son national park is a best choice for those who are interested in exploring the Nature.
Covering of 15,000 hectares in Tan Son district, as decided by the Prime Minister in 2002, the park was transferred from a nature reserve to a national park.
The park is residence to 365 species of animals, including of 47 listed in Viet Nam's Red Book of Endangered Species and 3 classified in the World Red Book, and to 22 plant species which are listed in Viet Nam’s Red Book and World Red Book .
In addition, the park has prominent natural landscapes with hundreds of caves such as Na, Lang, Lun, Coi, Son Duong, Tho Than, Thien Nga… which boasts inside beautiful stalactites and the beauty of the Chin Tang Waterfall, Ngoc Waterfall, or Lung Troi Waterfall and three peaks - Voi, Ten and Can - with heights of over 1,000 metres each.
Xuan Son has 4 seasons a day for visitors to experience: fresh morning as spring, sunny summer in the afternoon, autumn with soft breezes in the evening, and winter with a little cold at night.
And then, the visitors can visit the villages in Xuan Son national park such as: Coi, Lang, Du, Ben Than… and explore local life of ethnic minority.
Walking in Xuan Son National Park to discover the imposing nature.
With all the advantages, in the future, Xuan Son National Park will surely become a popular ecotourism destination, attract not only the local but also foreign tourists.
Vice Chairman of the Phu Tho People's Committee Ha Ke San works at the Hung Kings temple relic site
Vice Chairman of Phu Tho People's Committee Ha Ke San concluded the conference.
PTO – On September 13th, Mr.Ha Ke San - Vice Chairman of the Phu Tho People's chaired the conference and listened to leaders of Hung Kings temple relic site reporting the regulation on the construction management according to the planning project to preserve and promote the value of the Hung Kings temple relic site by 2025.
At the conference, the delegates discussed and commented on the contents of the regulation.
In particular, for the area’s inhabitant, the delegates said that there should be clear and appropriate regulations to facilitate the people as well as ensure the planning.
To conclude the conference, Vice Chairman of the Provincial People's Committee Ha Ke San stressed that as a special national historical relic, the regulation on the management of construction according to the planning project to preserve and promote the value of the Hung Kings temple relic site was very important. The Party, authorities and Phu Tho people were also responsible for the implementation and management of the Prime Minister's planning project to preserve and promote the value of the Hung Kings temple relic site.
He noted that it was necessary to reconsider the specific content of the object category, the scope of application, the scope of the boundary; regulations of the preservation and promotion of the values, along with construction management.
The Vice chairman of the Provincial People's Committee also requested after the conference, the departments, branches, units relating received the opinions of delegates in order to quickly complete the regulation then submit it to the Provincial People's Committee for consideration and promulgation.

After breakfast, the coach will take you to Da Chong Port to get of the boat for a visit to Nha Phu Lagoon.

or participate in sports and entertainment services: Canoeing, parachuting, water motoring, etc.
(expenses excluded).

Long Son pagoda - an ancient pagoda with the largest scale among over 20 pagodas in Nha Trang.
The pagoda is located within the city of Nha Trang, at the foot of Trai Thuy Hill.
This is also one of the famous tourist attractions in Nha Trang.
2. Freely go for a walk in the seashore (or participated in Vinpearl Land entertainment world (expenses excluded) with such games as: 
spinning acrobatics, carousel horse, gliding, racing, space exploration, or swimming in the sea, swimming in the largest pool in Southeast Asia, etc.
and enjoy modern music performances.

(dinner excluded).
Stay overnight in Nha Trang.

You also continue to visit and buy specialties at Dam Market.

TOUR PROGRAM.
DAY 1: HANOI – CAN THO Meals: 2 meals (lunch, dinner).
The coach and tour guide shall pick you up at No.03 Hai Ba Trung-Hanoi to depart to Noi Bai.
The tour guide shall support in making procedures for flight to Tra Noc - Can Tho. On arrival, have lunch and check in.
In the afternoon, continue to visit the Phuong Nam Zen Monastery -a the largest temple in Mekong Delta, visit Drum tower, Bell tower, worship Buddha in the main hall.
The Monastery was built with traditional ethereal architecture, you will be impressed with ironwood furniture and all kinds of precious wood brought from South Africa, especially the wooden statues that are made from two rare pine trees with more than 2 m horizontal diameter.
In the evening, be free to discover Tay Do at night.
Stay overnight in Can Tho.
CAN THO – CA MAU – BAC LIEU Meals: 3 meals.
Visit Ninh Kieu Wharf, take a boat to go sightseeing on Can Tho River towards Cai Rang Floating Market - A typical form of Mekong River Delta area, free to enjoy and buy specialties of the West (expenses excluded).
On the way to Bac Lieu, visit the Ma Toc Pagoda (Doi Pagoda) - which was built over 400 years ago and is the home of thousands of bats.
Then, pay a visit to Clay Pagoda - A famous pagoda not only by hundreds of clay statues and the clay-coated temple columns but also for three pairs of candles including 2 pairs with each candle filled up to 200kg of wax; the remaining pair of 100kg per candle that has been burned for over 40 years remains unburnt.
After lunch, continue to visit the Prince of Bac Lieu House - this house was built in 1919, designed by a French engineer and the all incorporated materials were brought from France.
After completion, it was considered as the largest house in The Six Provinces of Southern Vietnam at that time.
And above all, it used to be an ana of the resplendent life of Master Ba Huy (Tran Trinh Huy) - Dubbed "Prince of Bac Lieu".
After that, pay a visit to the Tac Say Church (Vuong Buu Diep Church).
Then, depart to Ca Mau.
Upon arrival in Ca Mau, check in.
Stay overnight in Ca Mau.
CA MAU – BAC LIEU – CAN THO Meals: 3 meals.
You will start the journey to Nam Can in the morning, take a motor boat to Dat Mui.
On the way, admire the Phan Ngoc Hien Statute - a works for memorizing Hon Khoai uprising led by teacher Phan Ngoc Hien.
On arrival in Dat Mui, visit Ca Mau Tourism Park - situated in Biosphere Reserves of the World recognized by UNESCO in May 2009.
Here, you will admire the imposing landscape of immense mangrove and blue color of sea and sky at the Observation Deck, continue to visit National Landmark and Ca Mau Cape.
In the afternoon, depart to Can Tho.
On arrival, check in and eat dinner In the evening, be free to discover Tay Do at night.
Stay overnight in Can Tho.
CAN THO – HA NOI Meals: 2 meals (breakfast, lunch).
After breakfast, you are free to go shopping of specialities in market.
the tour guide shall take you to the airport to make the procedures flight back to Hanoi(for the flight to Ha Noi after noon, Vietravel will bonus a lunch).
Upon arrival at Noi Bai airport, the coach shall take you to the gathering point; the tour ends.

Collapse.

After dinner, you are free to walk to Ninh Kieu wharf, enjoy a cup of coffee in the cool breeze of the Hau River, or walk on Ninh Kieu pedestrian bridge - wavy S-shaped bridge, which spans Khai Luong canal connecting Ninh Kieu wharf and Cai Khe Isle, on the bridge, there are two lotus and color LED system controlled under different scenarios to create vivid and modern beauty.
Overnight in Can Tho.

In the evening, you are free to sit down the Dragon Boat to travel on the Perfume River and enjoy Hue songs, drop flower garlands and bless for luck and peace (Expenses excluded).
Stay overnight in Hue.
DAY 5: HUE - PHONG NHA CAVE - PARADISE CAVE (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner).
Collapse.
You depart early to Dong Hoi (Quang Binh), stop along the way to visit the Truong Son Martyrs' Cemetery.
Then, continue to Phong Nha Cave - which is considered as the "fairyland" by being hidden in the limestone, covered by tropical forests, magnificent cave system with the longest underground river in the world. Continue to visit the new cave in the World Heritage Site of Phong Nha - Ke Bang: Paradise Cave - Viewed as an underground palace, thanks to beautiful and dreamy limestone caves, with a record in the 30 km length.
Check in at the hotel
Stay overnight in Quang Binh.
DAY 6: QUANG BINH - LA VANG HOLY LAND - LANG CO - DA NANG (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner).
Collapse.
Depart to Hue, on the way, stop to visit the Quang Tri ancient citadel, listen to explanation on Demilitarized Zone DMZ and Hien Luong Bridge - Ben Hai River (17th parallel), then continue the journey to the La Vang Holy Land.
Continue the journey to Da Nang, stop to visit and take photos at Lang Co before going through Hai Van to Da Nang City, then check in and free at leisure.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.
DAY 7: DA NANG - BA NA - HOI AN (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner).
Collapse.
You take a car to visit the Ba Na - Suoi Mo, upon arrival, take the world's longest one-rope cable car to the Ba Na Mountain (cable car expenses excluded), enjoy the chilly air of the "Da Lat in the Central," then free to visit or travel by the hiking train (expenses excluded): Linh Ung Pagoda, Debay Cellars, Le Jardin D'Amour Garden, etc. Next, you shall go to a new spiritual area of Ba Na to visit the Linh Chua Linh Tu Temple. Continue to the Fantasy Park:
In the afternoon, the coach will take you to visit Hoi An Old Town: Bridge Pagoda, Phung Hung Ancient House, Phuoc Kien Assembly Hall.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.
DAY 8: DA NANG - SON TRA PENINSULA (Breakfast, Lunch).
Collapse.
Take a coach to  visit the Ngu Hanh Son: Linh Ung Pagoda, Tang Chon Cave, Hoa Nghiem Cave, Non Nuoc Pagoda, Non Nuoc stone carving village.
Continue to take a look around the Son Tra Peninsula, visit the Linh Ung Pagoda - which has a statue of the tallest Guan Yin Buddha statue in Vietnam (67m) Standing here, you will admire the panoramic view of the city, mountain and Son Tra island in a perfect way.
Then, you shall take a coach to the Da Nang airport for a flight bck to Ho Chi Minh City.

Vietravel.
DAY 1: HCMC - SADEC - CAN THO Number of meal: 3 meals.
Collapse.
Tourists gather at Vietravel Company (190 Pasteur, District 3, HCMC) to visit Tien Giang and have lunch at Meking Rest Stop.
After that, tourists visit Sa Dec and admire My Thuan Bridge - The first suspension bridge in Vietnam, the pride of the people in the Mekong Delta.
When visiting Sa Dec, the group visits Kien An Cung Pagoda - this is an ancient pagoda of the Chinese people built 100 years ago. It has unique architecture, and it is recognized as a national historic relic by Ministry of Culture.
Then tourists visit Huynh Thuy Le Ancient House - a house of a rich man in Sa Dec, who had romance with a Frech female writers, Marguerite Duras, author of “The Lovers” (L’Amant), a famous work made into film.
In the afternoon, tourists visit Can Tho and Phuong Nam Temple - the largest temple in Mekong Delta. Then tourists visit Drum Tower, Campanile and Buddhist ceremony in the Main Hall.
The Temple was built with traditional gracious architecture. Tourists will be impressed with ironwood furnitures and precious wood types brought from South Africa, especially the Buddha statue made from precious cedar wood with diameter of 2m.
Then, the group visits My Khanh Tourist Area - an attractive Ecotourist attraction with fun traditional games such as: fishing, rowing, pig racing, etc., and visits Ancient House.
After having dinner, tourists can freely go for a walk to Ninh Kieu Wharf and enjoy coffee and the cool wind from Hau River, or walk on Ninh Kieu Footbridge - an S-shaped bridge accoss Khai Luong Canal and connecting Ninh Kieu Wharf to Con Cai Khe. The bridge has two lotus statues and LED system controlled by different scenarios, which brings a vivid and modern beauty.
Tourists spend the night in Can Tho.
DAY 2: CAN THO - CA MAU Number of meal: 3 meals.
Collapse.
Tourists visit Ninh Kieu Wharf and have a river tour on Can Tho River to Cai Rang Floating Market - a typical market type in Mekong Delta. Tourists can freely enjoy and buy Western specialties (self-supported).
Tourists have lunch in Bac Lieu.
After the lunch, tourists visit Prince of Bac Lieu House - a house built in 1919, designed by a French engineer. All building materials were brought from France.
After the construction, it was considered as the greatest house in The Six Provinces of Southern Vietnam at that time.
Moreover, the highlight is the anecdote of the golden life of Ba Huy (Tran Trinh Huy) - known as Prince of Bac Lieu.
Tourists arrive Ca Mau and check into the hotel for resting.
In the evening, tourists can freely go for a walk on the night market to enjoy Southern food through specialties such as banh tam ga cay, banh lot ga, bun nuoc leo, etc., 
and admire the center statue or Phan Ngoc Hien Bridge under the attractive color-changing lights.
Tourists spend the night in Ca Mau.
DAY 3: CA MAU - DAT MUI - BAC LIEU Number of meal: 3 meals.
Collapse.
In the morning, tourists visits Nam Can. After arriving the wharf, tourists visit Dat Mui on canoes.
On the way there, tourists can admire Phan Ngoc Hien Statue - a construction in memory of Hon Khoai revolution led by Phan Ngoc Hien.
After arriving Dat Mui, the groups visits Mui Ca Mau Cuture Tourism Park located in the Mui Ca Mau World Biosphere Reverse recognized by UNESCO in May 2009.
Tourists can admire the majestic beauty of vast mangrove forest and the blue sky through the Observatory. Then, the tourists continue to visit National Coordinate Landmark and the Bow.
In the afternoon, the group returns Bac Lieu to visit Tac Say Church (Father Truong Buu Diep Church).
In the evening, tourists can freely go for a walk and enjoy specialties such as sour, spicy and pleasing Turnip Cake or Vietnamese Crepe at longan garden, etc.
Then, tourists spend the night in Bac Lieu.
DAY 4: BAC LIEU - SOC TRANG - HCMC Number of meal: 2 meals (breakfast, lunch).
Collapse.
Tourists have breakfast and check out from the hotel.
The car drives tourists to visit and take photo at Cao Van Lau Theatre (Conical hat theatre) - the heart of the Square.
Tourists have lunch in Can Tho.
Then the group returns to Ho Chi Minh City. Then Vietravel drives tourists to the gathering point and ends the tour.

Collapse.

or taste seafood (at your own expense).
In the afternoon, select one of two programs below.
1.Visit Long Son pagoda which is an ancient pagoda with the largest scale among over 20 pagodas in Nha Trang.
2. Vinpearl Land entertainment world (expenses excluded) with such games as: spinning acrobatics, carousel horse, gliding, racing, space exploration, or swimming in the sea, swimming in the largest pool in Southeast Asia, etc.
and enjoy modern music performances.
You will, at your own cost, pay for transport back to the hotel.
Stay overnight in Nha Trang.

Collapse.

depart to Da Lat.
At night, You freely enjoy coffee in the mild air of the mountainous city.
Overnight in Da Lat.
DAY 4: DA LAT - THE FLOWER CITY Meals included: 3 meals.
Collapse.
You visit and conquer Langbiang Mountain - The roof of Central Highlands, have the panoramic view of mountain, Dankia lake, Suoi Vang with the meandering rivers seen from above 
(Go to the Mountain by Jeep car as a choice - At your own expense).
Continue to visit Golden Valley - attractive sceneries with the gardens, stone area, bonsai garden or artificial waterfall, etc.
In the afternoon, Bao Dai Private Residence (Dinh III) - The place where the family of final King in the feudal dynasties of Vietnam lived in and worked, is the next destination.
coach takes You to visit the longest Clay-art underground with majestic, impressive sculptures in terracotta recognized in Vietnam Book of Records.
Pay a visit Da Lat Market and buy the local specialties.
Stay overnight in Da Lat.
DAY 5: DA LAT - HO CHI MINH CITY Meals included: 2 meals (Breakfast - Lunch).
Collapse.
In the morning, you will visit Truc Lam Temple - Get the panoramic view of Tuyen Lam Lake with the beautiful nature, mountains and pine forest in Da Lat, etc.
Continue to visit the Falls Datanla - Here you can conquer the challenge to slide the tube service to visit the falls ( expenses excluded ).

TOUR PROGRAM.
Vietravel.
DAY 1: HO CHI MINH CITY - DA NANG (Lunch - Dinner).
Collapse.
You are present at the Tan Son Nhat Airport, Column 10 - Vietravel's counter, Domestic Terminal.
The tour guide shall make the procedures for you to catch a flight to Da Nang.
Upon arrival in Da Nang Airport, Vietravel's coach and tour guide shall pick up and take you to visit the Ngu Hanh Son: Linh Ung Pagoda, Tang Chon Cave, Hoa Nghiem Cave, Non Nuoc Pagoda, etc.
Them,take a look around the Son Tra Peninsula, visit the Linh Ung Pagoda - which has a statue of the tallest Guan Yin Buddha statue in Vietnam (67m).
In the afternoon, you shall take a coach to My Khe Beach - one of the most charming beach in the planet.
Next, continue to the Hoi An Ancient Town: Bridge Pagoda, Phung Hung Ancient House, Phuoc Kien Assembly Hall, Crafts establishments, then roam freely on the streets of colorful lanterns and buy souvenirs, test your skills in traditional games such as breaking earthen pot, Bai Choi singing.
Stay overnight in Da Nang.
DAY 2: DA NANG – BA NA – HUE (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner).
Collapse.
You take a coach to visit the Ba Na - Suoi Mo, upon arrival, take the world's longest one-rope cable car to the Ba Na Mountain (cable car expenses excluded), 
enjoy the chilly air of the "Da Lat in the Central", then visit Linh Ung Pagoda, Debay Cellars, Le Jardin D'Amour Garden, etc. Next, you shall go to a new spiritual area of ​​Ba Na to visit the Linh Chua Linh Tu Temple,the Fantasy Park
Continue to go through Hai Van Tunnel - thelongest tunnel in the Southeast Asia region to Hue, on the way to stop and take photos at Lang Co Bay - one of the most beautiful bays in the world.
On arrival in Hue, check in and free at leisure.
In the evening, you are free at leisure or explore Hue City at night.
Stay overnight in Hue.
DAY 3: HUE - LA VANG - PHONG NHA CAVE (Breakfast – Lunch - Dinner).
Collapse.
After buffet breakfast at the hotel, you shall arrive in Dong Hoi (Quang Binh), on the way, stop to visit the La Vang Holy Land - An important shrine of Vietnamese Catholics in Quang Tri, and then visit the Truong Son Martyrs' Cemetery.
Then, continue to Phong Nha Cave - which is considered as the "fairyland" by being hidden in the limestone, covered by tropical forests, magnificent cave system with the longest underground river in the world, next visit: Bi Ky Cave, Toc Tien Cave, Cung Dinh Cave, etc.
Then, depart to Hue at little late, about 08:00 pm.
Stay overnight in Hue.
(Note: In case, you do not visit the Phong Nha Cave, but freely visit and explore Hue on a whole day and self support lunch and dinner, please inform at the time of registration: refund of VND 350,000).
DAY 4: HUE - DA NANG -HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast - Lunch).
Collapse.
Eat buffet breakfast at the hotel. Then, take a coach to visit the Tomb of Tu Duc - with charming landscapes and to be one of the tombs with the most beautiful architecture of the Nguyen Kings.
Then, take a coach to visit the Hue Imperial City - the ancient palace of 13 Kings of the Nguyen Dynasty, visit Ngo Mon Gate, Thai Hoa Palace, Purple Forbidden City, The Temple, Hien Lam, Cuu Dinh, then, continue to visit the Thien Mu Pagoda-which is considered as the oldest pagoda in Hue and has preserved many valuable artifacts not only in term of history but also in art.
Next, Vietravel's coach shall take you to the Da Nang airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.

TOUR PROGRAM.
Vietravel.
DAY 1: HCMC - HUE Number of meal: 2 (lunch and dinner).
Collapse.
Tourists gather at Tan Son Nhat Airport, Column No.4, Domestic Terminal. Vietravel tour guides will support the Hue flight procedure for tourists.
At Phu Bai - Hue Airport, Vietravel cars and tour guides drive tourists to Tomb of Tu Duc - a place with charming landscape of mountain and river, which is considered as one of the most beautiful designed mausoleums of Nguyen dynasty.
Vietravel’s cars drive tourists to Dai Noi - the old Royal Palace of 13 Nguyen Kings, Ngo Mon Gate, Thai Hoa Palace, Purple Forbidden City, The Mieu Temple, Hien Lam Cac Pavilion, Cuu Dinh, etc.
The group continues to visit Thien Mu Pagoda - considered as the oldest pagoda in Hue, which stores lots of precious antiques in terms of history and art.
Tourists spend the night in Hue.
DAY 2: HUE - PARADISE CAVE Number of meal: 3 (breakfast, lunch and dinner).
Collapse.
The group takes early departure to Dong Hoi (Quang Binh), and visit Truong Son Martyr’s cemetery on the road.
Paradise Cave - considered as the underground Royal Palace with a beautiful and marvelous limestone cave having a record length of over 30 km.
Tourists spend the night in Quang Binh.
DAY 3: QUANG BINH - LA VANG - LANG CO - DA NANG Number of meal: 3 (breakfast, lunch and dinner).
Collapse.
Tourists take a departure to Hue and visit Quang Tri Ancient Citadel on the way and listen to the tour guide’s introduction of the Demilitarized Zone and Hien Luong Brigde - Ben Hai River (the 17th parallel), then continue to visit La Vang Holy Land.
Lang Co Bay - one of the most beautiful bays in the world for photograph before going through Hai Van Tunnel to Da Nang.
In the afternoon, the group visits Son Tra Peninsula and Linh Ung Pagoda - This place has the highest Quan Yin Statue of Vietnam (67m).
Standing here, tourists can comprehensively admire the whole view of the city, the mountain and Son Tra Sea.
In the evening, tourists can rest at the hotel. Tourists spend the night in Da Nang.
DAY 4: DA NANG - CU LAO CHAM - HOI AN Number of meal: 3 (breakfast, lunch and dinner).
Collapse.
The cars drive tourists to Cua Dai to begin the island exploration tour. After the canoe arrives Bai Lang, tourists visit Cu Lao Cham Conservation Area, Hai Tang Pagoda, Au Thuyen, etc., 
to learn about the island residents’ lives.
After that, boats bring tourists to Bai Xep to freely snorkel to see coral.
After visiting Bai Ong, tourists can immerse in the blue sea and the white sand beach.
In the afternoon, the canoe brings tourists to the mainland. After that, tourists continue to visit Hoi An Ancient Town: Cau Pagoda, Phung Hung Ancient House, Phuoc Kien Assembly Hall, Handicraft Facility, etc., 
Then, tourists spend a night in Da Nang.
DAY 5: DA NANG - BA NA - HCMC Number of meal: 2 (breakfast, lunch).
Collapse.
The cars drive tourists to Ba Na - Suoi Mo, after arriving, tourists take the cable car to Ba Namountain peak (self-sufficient), and enjoy the chilly air of “Da Lat in Central Region”, and visit: Linh Ung Pagoda, Debay Wine cella, Le Jardin D’Amourgarden, etc. Then, tourist visit the new Spiritual Landmark of Ba Na and Linh Chua Linh Tu Temple Fantasy Park
Then, tourists have lunch.
Vietravel’s cars will drive tourists to Da Nang Airport to catch the flight to HCMC.
Vietravel will say goodbye to tourists and end the tour program at Tan Son Nhat Airport.

TOUR PROGRAM.
Vietravel.
DAY 1: HCM City - Noi Bai Airport (HANOI) - YEN BAI - NGHIA LO (Including lunch and dinner).
Collapse.
Gathering in Tan Son Nhat International Airport (Domestic Terminal), receiving guidance to fulfill procedure of the flight to Hanoi.
Arriving at Noi Bai International Airport, starting traveling to Yen Bai.
On the way to Yen Bai, visiting:
- Hung King’s Temple: the place to worship the Hung Kings - who are the first founder of the country, the ancestors of the Vietnamese people, a solemn relic complex on Nghia Linh mountain.
Worshiping ancestors, visiting Thuong temple, Trung temple, Ha temple, Gieng Temple, King Hung Tomb.
- In the evening, enjoying Xoe dancing, finding beautiful traditional culture of Thai ethnic.
Spending a night in Nghia Lo.
DAY 2: NGHIA LO - MU CANG CHAI - SAPA (Including breakfast, lunch, and dinner).
Collapse.
Checking out, going to Mu Cang Chai, passing by:
- Tu Le, enjoying a faint pleasant smell of “new rice” on the roof, a famous place of sticky rice, dried rice flakes.
- Khau Pha Pass: the most dangerous and longest pass on National Highway 32 which is listed as one of “four longest passes” with the length of over 30 kilometers.
- Lim Mong Village: a village of Mong people with the most beautiful paddles in Mu Cang Chai.
Being ready to get in a stupor for beauty of the famous terraced rice fields in 3 communes: La Pan Tan, Che Cu Nha và Ze Xu Phinh.
Visiting large valleys, corners and rice fields curved and folded along the continuous mountain range.
- In the evening, walking and viewing Stone Church of Sapa, having free time to enjoy highland specialties, such as: Roasted pork, roasted eggs, Docynia wine, chatting with ethnic people.
Spending a night in Sapa.
DAY 3: SAPA - DONG TIEN SON - LAI CHAU (Including breakfast, lunch, and dinner).
Collapse.
Starting going to Lai Chau, passing by:.
- Bac Waterfall.
- O Quy Ho Pass: In between Lao Cai and Lai Chau, the pass meandering along Hoang Lien mountain range and also called Sky Gate, one of “four longest passes” in the East of Tay Bac.
- Conquering majestic Fansipan mountain with cable (paid by guest) - named as “the roof of Dong Duong” at the height of 3,143 meters.
Besides, at departure terminal, visiting Trinh Pagoda or wishing wealth and peace to family at Ha Pagoda in departure terminal.
- Tien Son Cave: with marvelous colored veins in various shapes.
The feature is cave bed with a clear stream passing by, meandering along the cave through four seasons.
Spending a night in Lai Chau.
DAY 4: LAI CHAU - DIEN BIEN (Including breakfast, lunch, and dinner).
Collapse.
Starting going to Dien Bien:
- On the way, enjoying the beauty of Tay Bac mountains along Nam Na river and the wetland due to raised water from the damp of Son La Hydropower Plant at the junction of the three rivers including: Da river, Nam Na river and Nam Rom river.
- Dien Bien Phu Museum: Built in 1984 on vacation of 30 years of the historic victory of Dien Bien Phu.
- A1 Hill and Cementary: Visiting A1 Hill, bunker of General de Castries.
Spending a night in Dien Bien.
DAY 5: DIEN BIEN - SON LA - MOC CHAU – HAPPY LAND RESORT (Including breakfast, lunch and dinner).
Collapse.
Starting going to Moc Chau - Son La, visiting:
- Pha Din Pass: Also one of the “four longest passes” in the East of Tay Bac and listed as one of the six most impressive passes in Vietnam.
- Happy Land Moc Chau Resort: Laying in a large valley in Lun village, surrounding with white mountain slopes, and along its downstream there is Sap stream running from Laos with clean and clear water, etc.
All of things create a beautiful and enchanting landscape.
- Moc Chau Tea Plantation: Tea fields along the hills look like greenish terraced rice fields stretching endlessly.
- Specialties produced from famous fresh milk of Moc Chau’s cows, which could be very good as gifts.
Spending a night in Moc Chau.
DAY 6: MOC CHAU – MAI CHAU (LAC VILLAGE) - NOI BAI INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT (HANOI) (Including breakfast and lunch).
Collapse.
Starting going to Hoa Binh, visiting:
- Lac Village in Mai Chau - Understanding stilt houses, traditions, home stay style of Thai people here.
Taking lunch in Hoa Binh.
Then, going back to Noi Bai International Airport to take a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Saying goodbye and closing the tour at Tan Son Nhat International Airport.

TOUR PROGRAM.
DAY 1: HO CHI MINH - NOI BAI (HANOI) - LAO CAI - SAPA (Lunch - Dinner).
Collapse.
You are present at the Tan Son Nhat Airport, Column 4, Domestic Terminal.
The tour guide shall make the procedures to catch a flight to Hanoi.
Vietravel's coach shall pick you up at Noi Bai airport, and then depart to Sa Pa on the modern and longest highway in Vietnam.
Upon arrial in Sapa, check in and free at leisure.
In the afternoon, visit the Ta Van - Lao Chai Village. The road into Ta Van is winding with a side of Muong Hoa valley with fertile terraced fields adorned by the green of maize and rice.
Upon arrival at Ta Van Village, visit the houses of the Mong, Dao, Giay ethnic groups, and surely you will be surprised at the idyllic, rustic beauty .
In the evening, go for a walk and admire Sapa Stone church, then enjoy regional specialties such as: grilled pork, baked eggs, Tao Meo wine (a kind of traditional wine), communication with ethnic people.
Stay overnight in Sapa.
DAY 2: SA PA – MAJESTIC FANSIPAN - LAO CAI (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner).
Collapse.
In the afternoon, climb the Ham Rong Mount for sightseeing and photography of Sapa town in fog, visit the blooming orchid garden, the central garden, watch the majestic Mount Fansipan, Heaven Gate, Thach Lam Dragon Head, Cloud Yard.
Return to Lao Cai and check in.
Freedom to explore the city at night.
Stay overnight in Lao Cai.
DAY 3: SA PA - LAO CAI - HANOI (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner).
Collapse.
Check out, then visit the border gate of Vietnam - China "Lao Cai - Hekou", go shopping at Coc Leu market.
Return to Hanoi and check in.
The coach shall take you to take a stroll around Sword Lake and watch Turtle Tower, Ngoc Son Temple, The Huc Bridge.
In the evening, you are free to explore Ha Noi at night.
Stay overnight in Hanoi.
DAY 4: HANOI - YEN TU - HA LONG (Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner).
Collapse.
Continue to visit and find out about the life and work of the father of the nation at the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum (it is not open for visiting on weekly Mondays and Fridays), Uncle Ho's Stilt House, Ho Chi Minh Museum, One Pillar Pagoda.
Then, visit the Temple of Literature - where worships the Confucius and the Confucian sages - the first University of Vietnam.
Continue the journey to Halong, visit the Yen Tu Mountain (cable car costs excluded) - a natural attraction that was preserved with many historical sites and is known as "the land of Buddhism in Vietnam".
Then, visit the Hoa Yen Pagoda - a large and beautiful pagoda, situated on the halfway 516m in altitude, visit the Hue Quang Tower (Thap To).
Return to Ha Long in the afternoon, check in.
In the evening, take a coach to Bai Chay Bridge and then watch Ha Long City at night.
Stay overnight in Halong.
DAY 5: HA LONG - (Cat Bi) HAI PHONG - HO CHI MINH CITY (Breakfast - Lunch).
Collapse.
Go to the wharf and take a cruise to go sightseeing in Ha Long Bay - a beautiful natural and extremely vivid scene, which was a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994.
Then, visit and explore the magnificence and luxury of the Heaven Palace Cave.
From the cruise, you can watch the islands in Halong Bay, including: Ga Choi Island, Lu Huong Island, etc.
Next, take a coach to the Cat Bi airport (Hai Phong) for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City.
Say goodbye to you and end the tour at Tan Son Nhat airport.

Compiling dossier on Cham ethnic pottery to submit to UNESCO.
Update:
Views:
The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism has ratified Ninh Thuan provincial People’s Committee’s proposal on compiling a dossier on Cham ethnic pottery to secure UNESCO’s recognition as an intangible cultural heritage in need of urgent safeguarding.
The Ministry noted that during the planning and documenting process, Ninh Thuan provincial Department of Culture, Sports and Tourism and the Viet Nam National Institute of Culture and Arts Studies - Ho Chi Minh city branch have to conduct surveys, study and invite localities with Cham ethnic traditional pottery to participate.
One of the outstanding characteristics of the Cham ethnic traditional pottery making is the technique of making pottery without turntables, and open firing with straw and fire-wood. They are unique products bearing many cultural history marks of the ethnic minority group. Cham ethnic people use their skilled hands to create a variety of products in different designs, serving the needs of daily activities, beliefs and religions, while expressing the creativity and cultural identity of the Cham ethnic group. They include water containers, rice containers, reliefs, decorative lamps, statues of Apsara and Shiva.
Pottery traditional crafts of Cham ethnic group in Binh Thuan and the arts of pottery making of Cham ethnic group in Bau Truc village, Phuoc Dan town, Ninh Phuoc District, Ninh Thuan Province were recognized as national intangible cultural heritages.
Quang Binh pilots tours of new caves.
Update
Views:
Authorities of the central province of Quang Binh have decided to pilot tours of some new caves at the World Natural Heritage site Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park, dubbed the “Kingdom of Caves”.
Specifically, the management board of the park will partner with Jungle Boss Ltd., to pilot a two-day and one-night tour of the Dai A, Over, and Pygmy caves at the cost of 600,000 VND (26.6USD) per person.
Earlier, on July 4, Oxalic Ltd. was allowed to pilot a two-day and one-night tour of the Va and Nuoc Nut caves, worth 8 million VND per person, and a one-day tour of Nuoc Nut cave at the cost of 1.65 million VND per person.
The Va and Nuoc Nut caves are incomparable due to their unique, grandiose, and magnificent beauty.
Since early this year, tourist arrivals in Quang Binh have reached nearly 1.9 million, up about 17 percent year-on-year, bringing an estimated revenue of 2 trillion VND (88.8 million USD), marking a year-on-year increase of 15 percent.
The Viet Nam Festival 2018 kicked off at Yoyogi park in the Japanese capital of Tokyo on May 19 on the occasion of the 128th birth anniversary of President Ho Chi Minh. Speaking at the opening ceremony, Vietnamese Ambassador to Japan Nguyen Quoc Cuong said that the event is part of important activities to take place in Japan in 2018 in celebration of the 45th anniversary of bilateral diplomatic ties.
Besides Tokyo, the Viet Nam Festival will be organised in other localities across Japan, including Fukuoka, Aichi, Osaka, Kanagawa, and Saitama, within this year.
Former Japanese Prime Minister Yasuo Fukuda expressed his delight at the development of the two countries’ relations, while hoping that the friendship will be strengthened to meet aspirations.
There are around 240,000 Vietnamese people living in Japan, a tenfold increase compared with the figure five years ago.
The Viet Nam festival was first held in Japan in September 2008, becoming the biggest-ever festival of Viet Nam held in the country, attracting 150,000 visitors in just three days.
Since then, the festival has been organised annually and become the largest cultural exchange event between the two countries.
This year’s event has 120 pavilions, including 60 cuisine ones, and 50 others introducing the image of Vietnamese land and people and Vietnamese goods, along with art performances.
The two-day festival is expected to attract over 150,000 visitors.
Hectic Tuy Hoa fishing port at dawn
Visitors traveling to Tuy Hoa fishing port located in the coastal city of Tuy Hoa in Phu Yen Province at around 5 a.m. will have a chance to see how local fishermen begin the day early in the morning.
The fishing port is among the hectic trading places in the coastal city.
To local fishermen and traders, this is the most significant time when fishing boats laden with seafood return to the port after fishing trips.
A lot of baskets full of freshly-caught seafood are transported ashore one after another by suntanned men whose weather-battered faces always show happiness for their work.
Meanwhile, traders swiftly pick some baskets containing the freshest seafood and then deliver to many other places.
The fishing port is also very famous for the best tuna with certain ones weighing up to hundreds of kilograms.
Heading for the trading area situated right in the port, visitors will get amazed by the bustle and hustle of buyers and sellers.
A wide variety of fresh seafood such as fish, crab, prawn and squid are offered for sale.
Some people say seafood bought at the port is not actually cheaper than in other markets but they can choose the freshest items.
In addition to local people, a lot of tourists paying a visit to Phu Yen Province prefer going shopping at Tuy Hoa fishing port early in the morning.
They can also admire the beautiful sunrise over the horizon and fishing boats busily checking in and out at the same time.
Despite hard work under the sun, Phu Yen fishermen always give a broad grin on their faces.
To them, every fishing trip full of fish is a great happiness in the daily lives.
New life for Mekong floating market
The Mekong Delta province of Hau Giang is developing eco-tourism products based on its rivers, fruit orchards, and rural sights and life, according to its Department of Culture, Sports and Tourism.
They include Nga Bay floating market in Nga Bay town, an ecological tourism zone in Vi Thuy District and agriculture tourism in Vi Thanh city.
Do Chieu Qui, the department’s director, said the province was undertaking a 35 billion VND (1.5 million USD) project to revive Nga Bay floating market for tourism purposes.
The market would be turned into one of the province’s key river tourism products, he said.
Since the floating market was established in 1915 it was located at the meeting point of seven canals and rivers in Nga Bay town and become one of the delta’s busiest markets.
But a decade ago local authorities moved it to a new site three kilometres away to improve traffic safety at the confluence, and the market’s activities began to dwindle because of the inconvenient location.
The project to revive it is expected to be completed in 2019.
At the 145ha ecological tourism zone, several tasks have been completed, including the dredging of a 14km canal and creation of a 13ha fruit orchard, 5ha bird garden and 11ha area for breeding wild animals and freshwater aquatic species.
The zone is expected to be ready by the end of 2018, according to the department.
The department is also working with relevant agencies and district authorities to conserve and develop historic and cultural relics, including the Temple of Uncle Ho, Can Tho Party Committee base and Relics of Chuong Dien Victory.
The province has also set up community tourism sites at the Cau Duc pineapple farming area in Vi Thanh and Long Tri sweet mandarin area in Long My District and developed agricultural tourism in Vi Thanh.
Hau Giang has zoned off a 130ha eco-tourism area at the Mua Xuan Agricultural Centre in Phung Hiep District.
It also plans to develop eco-tourism at the 2,800ha Lung Ngoc Hoang Nature Wetland Reserve in Phung Hiep.
Hau Giang, located in the delta’s central part, hopes to attract 160,000 tourists a year, including 18,000 foreigners, by 2020, according to its tourism development plan.
Speaking at a meeting on August 12, the province’s Party Committee Secretary, Tran Cong Chanh, told local authorities to continue surveying sites so that appropriate tourism development plans can be made and human resources developed.
The investment to develop eco-tourism sites should be linked with the national programme to build new rural areas, he said.
The Department of Culture, Sports and Tourism should monitor and provide advice during the process of creating eco-tourism products at the Mua Xuan Agricultural Centre, he said.
After two years of implementing the province Party Committee’s Resolution No. 9 on developing tourism, Hau Giang has also organised many tourism training courses for households in eco-tourism areas.
On August 3, for instance, 40 farmers in Vi Thuy District were provided training in tourism.
The trainees also visited a community tourism model in the district.
Le Quoc Chien, who has participated in a tourism training course, offers tourism services in his 1ha fruit orchard in Vi Thanh.
He grows many kinds of fruits like durian, mangosteen, jack fruit, red flesh dragon fruit, mango and guava and also has ponds for tourists to fish.
Le Minh Tam of Nga Bay town’s Nga Bay Ward developed his 5ha Burmese grape orchard into a tourism site in 2014.
It receives about 100 tourists a day, and 300-400 during the peak Burmese grape harvest season.
Tam has tied up with travel companies in HCM City and Vinh Long and Kien Giang provinces to bring tourists to his orchard, which has fruits between April and September.
“I plan to replace old Burmese grape plants with other trees like king orange and rambutan to ensure my orchard has fruits year round.”
Grilled sharpbelly - A specialty of Phu Yen Province
As simple as the dish is but grilled sharpbelly is a very famous dish in the land of Phu Yen where visitors can hardly ignore.
Like other freshwater fishes such as sand goby and white fish, sharpbelly is long and thin, up to an adult finger, usually live in herds in the rivers and streams.
Fresh sharpbelly is washed and grilled or fried then is cooked over charcoal fire.
When grilling, you need to always turnover each side so that its scab is cooked without being charred.
It is served with vegetables of all kinds, fresh rice noodles, rice paper with spicy sauce.
There are many ways to eat grilled sharpbelly, it can be served with fish sauce and rice.
But the most delicious way is to roll with ricepaper and other vegetables, such as lettuce, cucumber; fragrant basil; slip basil; and fresh beansprout along with spicy chilli fish sauce. /
Diep Son islands - the most attractive beach in 2016 summer
Diep Son islands, located in the Van Phong Bay in the south central province of Khanh Hoa is well-known for its white-sand beach, crystal-clear water and the winding path connecting two islets.
Diep Son islands consist of three small islets.
